    DIVISION 6.4. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (19) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 24724, § 3, adopted April 9, 2014, repealed Division 6.4, §§ 2-199.10—2-199.12, which pertained to the office of senior citizens' services and derived from Ord. No. 22807, § 5, adopted July 19, 2006. Secs. 2-199.10—2-199.12. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 6.5. - DEPARTMENT OF PROPERTY MAINTENANCE ZONING/QUALITY OF LIFE

    Sec. 2-200. - Office and position of director of property maintenance zoning/quality of life.

    There is hereby created the department of property maintenance zoning/quality of life to serve the Parish of Jefferson and to oversee all inspection and enforcement responsibilities related to Jefferson Parish zoning and code ordinances regarding the use and maintenance of privately owned property and structures, overseeing the weed control division, and taxicab regulations. (Ord. No. 24726, § 2, 4-9-14)

    Sec. 2-201. - Qualifications, appointment and salary for the director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of property maintenance zoning/quality of life shall be qualified by a bachelor's degree in architecture; civil engineering; planning; law or related field, supplemented by extensive, successful, full-time paid experience; or an equivalent combination of five (5) years of supervisory experience, education and training in related field. (b) Appointment. The director of property maintenance zoning/quality of life shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of property maintenance zoning/quality of life shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 24726, § 2, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25736 , § 11, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 11, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-201 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications, appointment and salary for the director of property maintenance zoning/quality of life director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-202. - Duties of the director of property maintenance zoning/quality of life; generally.

    The director of property maintenance zoning/quality of life's duties shall include but are not limited to the following: (1) Directs, manages, and oversees the inspection and enforcement of ordinances and codes regarding the use and maintenance of privately owned property and structures. (2) Directs, manages and oversees the operations of the weed control division including contracting and budgeting functions. (3) Directs, manages and oversees the inspection and enforcement relative to quality of life and taxicab issues. (4) Keeps abreast of current developments relative to quality of life and taxicab issues, laws, regulations, codes, processes, plans, and procedures. (5) Develops operating budget and ensures department operates within approved budget; monitors budget activity; approves expenditures. (6) Meets with and responds to complaints, questions, and concerns from the public, developers, contractors, council members, other elected officials, administrative officers and department heads, sheriffs office and community business leaders within Jefferson Parish and the metropolitan area. (7) Creates and implements department policies and procedures to enforce codes, ordinances, and standards. Reviews and recommends code/ordinances changes. (8) Manages the adjudication process stemming from ordinance violations forwarded to the parish attorney's office. (9) Advises the parish president and parish council relative to quality of life and enforcement issues, weed control issues, taxicab issues, laws, processes, regulations, requirements, and procedures. (10) Prepares reports on department operations; evaluates department performance against goals and objectives; prepares special reports as required or directed. (11) Attends parish council meetings, civil service hearings, department related meetings, parish directors' meetings, civic group meetings, and any other meetings as required or directed. (12) Grants interviews with news media, prepares press releases in collaboration with the parish public information office and prepares other informational materials. (13) Performs all other duties as required or directed. (Ord. No. 24726, § 2, 4-9-14) Secs. 2-203—2-210. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 7. - OFFICE OF FIRE SERVICES

    Footnotes: --- (20) --Editor's note— Prior to their amendment by § 1 of Ord. No. 16844, adopted Apr. 30, 1986, §§ 2-211—2-213 related to the department and director of fire and emergency services and were derived from Code 1961, §§ 2280—2-283. The editor has deleted the term "and emergency services" from the division title to more accurately reflect the contents of the division. Emergency services are now covered by Div. 8 of this article. Subsequently, Ord. No. 21966, § 1, adopted Aug. 6, 2003, amended the title of Div. 7 from "department of fire" to "office of fire services." Ord. No. 22692, § 1, adopted February 8, 2006, amended Div. 7 by changing the title of "superintendent of fire" to "director of fire." See also the Code Comparative Table. Cross reference— Ambulances, Ch. 5; homeland security, emergency management and disasters, Ch. 9; fire prevention and protection; emergency services and communication and hazardous material, Ch. 13.

    Sec. 2-211. - Position of director of fire created.

    The position of director of fire is hereby created, which position shall have oversight of the Jefferson Parish volunteer fire departments and coordinate parish-wide hazard preparedness and emergency response and any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (Ord. No. 16884, § 1, 4-30-86; Ord. No. 21966, § 1, 8-6-03; Ord. No. 22692, § 1, 2-8-07; Ord. No. 25287 , § 1, 1-11-17; Ord. No. 25736 , § 12, 2-6-19)

    Sec. 2-212. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of fire shall possess a knowledge of the daily operations of fire functions, budgeting techniques and management planning; demonstrate an ability to organize and lead; and possess proven oral and written communication skills. The director of fire shall also possess a four-year degree in business or public administration or fifteen (15) years experience in a mid-sized local government in similar fire services. (b) Appointment. The director of fire shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council and shall devote his entire efforts to the purpose for which this office has been created and any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of fire shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 16884, § 1, 4-30-86; Ord. No. 21966, § 2, 8-6-03; Ord. No. 22692, § 2, 2-8-07; Ord. No. 25736 , § 12, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 12, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-212 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director of fire" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-213. - Duties of director of fire.

    The director of fire shall: (1) Provide policy development and management guidance in the areas of emergency response as it relates to the Jefferson Parish Fire Training Center; (2) Oversee cooperative endeavor agreements of the volunteer fire departments; (3) Prepare reports regarding administrative operations, evaluate performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; for the Jefferson Parish Fire Training Center; (4) Develop and maintain budget for all divisions of the Jefferson Parish Fire Training Center, and Hazardous Materials Division; (5) Plan for capital improvements to the Jefferson Parish Fire Training Center; (6) Plan long-range activities for the Jefferson Parish Fire Training Center, and Hazardous Materials Division; (7) Collaborate with all volunteer fire chiefs and the emergency management director on policy decisions affecting emergency response services in Jefferson Parish; (8) Coordinate, and consult with all volunteer fires chiefs as applicable, for the completion of insurance rating reports for all Jefferson Parish Fire Districts; (9) Supervise all contracts for instructors for the Fire Training Center; (10) Collaborate with all the volunteer fire chiefs, the director of the office of telecommunications and the Sheriff of Jefferson Parish on policy decisions affecting emergency response services in Jefferson Parish relative to the Jefferson Parish Enhanced 9-1-1 system; (11) Coordinate fire activities with volunteer departments and serve as a liaison between the volunteer fire departments, fire stations, first responders, and the administration. (Ord. No. 16884, § 1, 4-30-86; Ord. No. 21966, § 3, 8-6-03; Ord. No. 22477, § 1, 4-13-05; Ord. No. 22692, § 3, 2-8-07; Ord. No. 24036, § 1, 6-15-11; Ord. No. 25287 , § 2, 1-11-17; Ord. No. 25736 , § 12, 2-6-19)

    Sec. 2-214. - Reserved.

    Editor's note— Ord. No. 25398 , § 3, adopted July 12, 2017, repealed § 2-214, which pertained to office of telecommunications; director of telecommunications and derived from Code of 1961, § 2-284; Ord. No 16887, § I, adopted April 30, 1986; Ord. No. 16996, § 1, adopted August 20, 1986; and Ord. No. 24036, § 2, adopted June 15, 2011.

    Sec. 2-215. - Reserved.

    Editor's note— Ord. No. 25398 , § 3, adopted July 12, 2017, repealed § 2-215, which pertained to maintenance of gate access code information for gated communities and derived from Ord. No. 24039, § 2, adopted June 29, 2011. Secs. 2-216—2-225. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 8. - DEPARTMENT OF EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT

    Footnotes: --- (21) ---

    Editor's note— In order to more accurately reflect the changes effected by § 1 of Ord. No. 16885, adopted April 30, 1986, the editor has changed the title of this division from "Department of Civil Defense" to "Department of Emergency Management." Cross reference— Homeland security, emergency management and disasters, Ch. 9. State Law reference— Local organizations for civil defense. R.S. 29:608.

    Sec. 2-226. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of emergency management is hereby created under the general direction of the director of homeland security, and position of director, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over emergency management department activities, resources, and personnel. Position is responsible for planning and implementing resources and staff to respond to disasters and other emergencies within Jefferson Parish in conformance and coordination with department of homeland security. (Code 1961, § 2-290; Ord. No. 16885, § 1, 4-30-86; Ord. No. 22630, § 3, 11-16-05)

    Sec. 2-227. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of the department of emergency management shall possess any combination of extensive, successful paid professional work experience or post-secondary academic achievement which indicates that the candidate could successfully perform the duties and responsibilities of this position. (b) Appointment. The director of emergency management shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of emergency management shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-292; Ord. No. 16885, § 1, 4-30-86; Ord. No. 22630, § 3, 11-16-05; Ord. No. 25736 , § 13, 2-619) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 13, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-227 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-228. - Duties of director.

    The director of emergency management shall: (1) Plan, manage, and direct daily activities of emergency management department; (2) Develop and implement department policies and procedures; (3) Manage staff and resources to meet all hazard emergencies; (4) Assign tasks and projects; monitor and review work; (5) Evaluate employee work performance, approve salary increases, discipline/discharge, transfer and promote employees; (6) Hire personnel; (7) Conduct staff meetings; (8) Advise parish president and council on emergency preparedness. Attend and participate in council and other meetings as required and requested; (9) Coordinate department activities with state and federal agencies. Act as parish liaison to state and federal agencies regarding emergencies and disasters. (10) Write and update hurricane preparedness manual; (11) Educate and direct education of citizens on emergency preparedness; (12) Grant interviews with news media, prepare press releases and other informational materials in accordance with established parish policies; (13) Respond during emergency/disaster situations; (14) Attend civil service hearings, department-related meetings, parish directors' meetings, civic group meetings, and all others as required or directed; (15) Conduct investigations relative to department operations, employee conduct, or other matters as required; (16) Perform all other duties as required or directed. (Code 1961, § 2-291; Ord. No. 16885, § 1, 4-30-86; Ord. No. 22630, § 3, 11-16-05; Ord. No. 24660, § 1, 1-1514)

    DIVISION 8.5. - DEPARTMENT OF ELECTRONIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS MANAGEMENT

    Sec. 2-229. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of electronic information systems management and the position of director of electronic information systems management is hereby created. Which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over all functions, duties, and responsibilities of data processing, geographic information systems, and coordination of all other parish computer operations including internal operations, equipment hardware and software, functional department and service operations and future modifications and/or expansion of existing and new systems. (Ord. No. 19649, § 2, 2-28-96)

    Sec. 2-230. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) [Qualifications generally.] The director of the department of electronic information systems management shall possess the following qualifications: (1) A thorough knowledge of governmental information systems and services, demonstrates an ability to manage complex operations, possess skills in computer analysis, have proven oral and written communication skills and demonstrate leadership skills in a local government setting. Director of electronic information systems management shall also possess the following qualifications: (2) A Bachelors Degree from an accredited college or university with significant paid satisfactory work experience in the management of electronic information systems within a government setting, and otherwise be qualified by training and other administrative and technical management experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of electronic information systems management shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of electronic information systems management shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 19649, § 2, 2-28-96; Ord. No. 25736 , § 14, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 14, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-230 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-231. - Duties of the director.

    The director of electronic information systems management shall: (1) Manage department operations of the electronic information systems management department and the office of telecommunications; (2) Direct staff persons assigned to the department, including hiring, termination, enforcement of work rules and regulations, delegation of department work assignments and other related administrative/management duties and responsibilities; (3) Provide policy guidance to the president and deputy C.A.A. in the area of electronic information systems; (4) Plan, formulate, develop, and evaluate operating policies, procedures and programs relating to use of various parish electronic information systems; (5) Member of the parish data processing advisory committee; (6) Negotiate and oversee any and all business activities with contracted computer related vendors and computer software providers; (7) Provide leadership for G.I.S./SCADA operations, data processing operations, and other related parish electronic information systems; (8) Interface with public works as it relates to G.I.S./SCADA operations and services; (9) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the electronic information systems management department; (10) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports relative to electronic information systems; (11) Serve as primary liaison to the government and non-government users of parish's electronic information systems; (12) May represent parish president or deputy C.A.A. at meetings relative to electronic information systems; (13) Conduct field inspections, visit and observe electronic information systems operations; and (14) Direct the operations of the telecommunications systems. (Ord. No. 19649, § 2, 2-28-96; Ord. No. 25398 , § 2, 7-12-17)

    DIVISION 8.6. - OFFICE OF TELECOMMUNICATIONS

    Footnotes: --- (22) --Cross reference— Ambulance services answering 911 calls, § 5-5; communications district, § 13-61 et seq.; 911 service providers board, § 2-867 et seq.

    Sec. 2-232. - Office of telecommunications and director of telecommunications created.

    The office of telecommunications and position of director of telecommunications is hereby created and are under the supervision of the director of electronic information systems. (Ord. No. 25398 , § 4, 7-12-17)

    Sec. 2-233. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of telecommunications must have five (5) years of highly responsible, professional level experience in the field of telecommunications. All experience must have been in the administrative or senior managerial capacity, with responsibility for the development, management and operation of a major division of a telecommunications organization network; to include Voice over Internet Protocol telephony, Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) trunking, Wide Area Networks, and video conferencing; must have a working knowledge of Enhanced 911 Service with ALI, ANI selective routing; must have a thorough knowledge of the Association of Public-Safety Communications Officers Project 25 (Phase I & Phase II) trunking radio systems; must have a thorough knowledge of public service commissioners rates and tariffs as they apply to parish telephone systems; must have a thorough knowledge of the Federal Communications Commission Rules and Regulations as they apply to local government agencies; must have thorough knowledge of consolidated fire, police, and emergency medical computer-aided dispatching; must have working knowledge of all radios and telephone equipment used in the parish. (b) Appointment. The director of telecommunications shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council and shall devote his entire efforts to the purpose for which this department has been created and any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (c)

    Salary. The salary of the director of telecommunications shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 25398 , § 4, 7-12-17; Ord. No. 25736 , § 15, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 15, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-233 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-234. - Duties of director.

    The director of telecommunications will be responsible for: (1) Management and supervision over all coordination, planning, and installation of new Jefferson Parish radio/telephone systems, including telephone and radio maintenance services, data transmission networks, teletype and facsimile networks, satellite and microwave services, mobile telephone services, intercoms and electromechanical paging and public address systems, radio paging eight hundred (800) MHz trunked and eight hundred (800) MHz conventional systems, related communications systems; (2) Serves as the liaison between Jefferson Parish and the Sheriff of Jefferson Parish regarding the operation of the Jefferson Parish Enhanced 911 Computer-Aided Dispatch Center; (3) Assumes full responsibilities for all telecommunications systems and maintenance services operated by the parish; (4) Directs, oversees, and coordinates the activities of all areas that comprise the office of telecommunication services; (5) Directs the development of the parish network for communications, all centralized and individual agency telephone systems for the parish; (6) Directs the development of performance specifications for procurement through the parish ownership or leasing of all communications equipment and systems; (7) Assures that all long- and short-term planning is performed in accordance with overall telecommunications policy of the parish; (8) Supervises all telecommunication contracts to ensure compliance with specifications of contracts; (9) Meets with other parish officials, including representatives of major users, groups, and boards, to ensure that planning is done in accordance with their needs and requirements; (10) Maintains a thorough knowledge and overall awareness of developments and trends in all areas of telecommunications through study and peer group activities; and (11) Develops policies and procedures to be adhered to by all parish departments. (Ord. No. 25398 , § 4, 7-12-17)

    Sec. 2-235. - Maintenance of gate access code information for gated communities.

    In addition to the duties and responsibilities listed in section 2-234 herein, the office of telecommunications shall compile and maintain a list of all gate access codes for all gated communities. The office of telecommunications shall update this list quarterly, each such update to be completed by no later than the 15th day of the months of January, April, July and October. The updates shall also include gate access codes for any new gated communities added by the office of telecommunications to its list of gated communities. The director shall make the updated lists of gate access codes available to the 9-1-1 Communications Center for distribution of the information to law enforcement, fire protection, hazardous materials or emergency medical personnel as needed to respond to emergencies. (Ord. No. 25398 , § 4, 7-12-17) Secs. 2-236—2-240. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 9. - DEPARTMENT OF ENGINEERING

    Footnotes: --- (23) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 17553, § 1, adopted July 13, 1988, repealed §§ 2-241—2-243, pertaining to the department of public utilities, replacing them with new sections concerning the department of engineering. Former §§ 2-241—2-243 derived from Code 1961, §§ 2-420—2-422.

    Sec. 2-241. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of engineering and position of director of engineering are hereby created to assist the department of public works in its duties and responsibilities. (Ord. No. 17553, § 2, 7-13-88)

    Sec. 2-242. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of engineering shall possess the following qualifications: (1) A four-year degree in engineering and active registration as a professional engineer in the state; (2) Ten (10) years' experience in engineering; and (3) Three (3) years' experience in local government operations or consulting work. (b) Appointment. The director of engineering shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the parish council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of engineering shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 17553, § 3, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 24699, § 1, 3-19-14; Ord. No. 25736 , § 16, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 16, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-242 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-243. - Duties of the director.

    The director of engineering shall assist the public works director in directing, controlling and supervising the following functions: (1) Engineering design, construction supervision and project management of all projects under the jurisdiction of the public works department; (2) Construction supervision of all water, sewerage, streets, and drainage infrastructure installation and all such facilities accepted for maintenance by the parish from private developments; (3) Traffic engineering and the associated design and maintenance of signals, signs and markings; (4) Street lighting with associated design, operation, and maintenance; (5) Planning of future, major street and bridge capital improvement projects, including maintenance and new construction; (6) Provide engineering services to the department of public works as required and directed by the director of the department of public works; (7) Surveying; (8) SCADA (supervisory control and automated data acquisition) system design and maintenance; (9) Public works warehouse facility operations and maintenance. (Ord. No. 17553, § 4, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 23213, § 3, 12-12-07; Ord. No. 24699, § 2, 3-19-14)

    DIVISION 9.5. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (24) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 22460, § 2, adopted March 23, 2005, repealed Div. 9.5, §§ 2-244—2-246, which pertained to the department of pumping stations. See also the Code Comparative Table. Secs. 2-244—2-255. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 10. - DEPARTMENT OF DRAINAGE

    Footnotes: --- (25) --Cross reference— Drainage, § 27-69 et seq.; drainage and sewerage disposal, § 27-142 et seq.

    Sec. 2-256. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of drainage and the position of director of drainage are hereby created to assist the public works department. (Code 1961, § 2-430; Ord. No. 17555, § 1, 7-13-88)

    Sec. 2-257. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of drainage shall be qualified by a four-year degree from an accredited college or university with degree in engineering and current registration as a professional engineer in the State of Louisiana plus five (5) years of engineering experience in the design and construction management of drainage projects, or ten (10) years of equivalent engineering experience with public works agency or consulting firm of which five (5) years' experience in the design and construction management of drainage projects. (b) Appointment. The director of drainage shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of drainage shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-432; Ord. No. 22460, § 1, 3-23-05; Ord. No. 25736 , § 17, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 17, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-257 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-258. - Duties of the director generally.

    The director of drainage shall: (1) Assist the public works director in the responsibility of drainage and control of storm waters to include canals, pumping stations, and all related structures within the boundaries of the parish; (2) Direct engineering personnel and field superintendents in planning and implementing drainage and flood control system project schedules; (3) Assist the department of capital projects in establishing scope of work and design criteria for drainage capital projects; (4) Direct engineers and consultants regarding department projects scope and design criteria; (5) Inspect operation/maintenance and construction projects; (6) Provide department policy and management guidance in all areas of drainage and pumping station operations; (7) Evaluate department operations for all areas of drainage and pumping stations and report to the parish president and the director of public works on drainage department performance; (8) Coordinate budget formulation activities for the department of drainage; coordinate annual five-year capital projects budget; review and authorize expenditures; (9) Direct the department of drainage in formulating and evaluating operating policies, programs and procedures and effective and efficient job performance; (10) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (11) Prepare policy statements and plans for the department of drainage under the direction of the director of public works; (12) Be responsible for the administrative management of operations and maintenance of all drainage department facilities and pumping stations; (13) Serve as department appointing authority and fulfill all duties and responsibilities required of an appointing authority. (Code 1961, § 2-431; Ord. No. 17555, § 2, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 22460, § 1, 3-23-05)

    DIVISION 10.5. - DEPARTMENT OF CAPITAL PROJECTS

    Sec. 2-259. - Department and positions of director created.

    The department of capital projects and public works coordination and position of director of capital projects and public works coordination is hereby created to assist the department of public works in its duties and responsibilities. (Ord. No. 19877, § 1, 11-20-96; Ord. No. 23051, § 1, 5-9-07)

    Sec. 2-260. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of capital projects shall possess the following qualifications: (1) A four-year degree in engineering and a registration as a professional engineer in the State of Louisiana; or (2) Ten (10) years' equivalent experience in engineering; and (3) Three (3) years' experience in local government operations or consulting work; and (4) Five (5) years' experience in capital projects management with a public works agency. (b) Appointment. The director of capital projects shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the parish council, and shall be assigned to group I of the executive pay plan. (c)

    Salary. The salary of the director of capital projects shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 19877, § 1, 11-20-96; Ord. No. 25736 , § 18, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 18, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-260 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-261. - Duties of director.

    The director of capital projects shall assist all parish departments in the following functions: (1) Provide department policy and management guidance in the area of capital projects aimed particularly at developing consistency and increasing efficiency and cost effectiveness; (2) Assist in development of standardized contract forms and procedures for project management; (3) Assist in evaluating and developing standard guidelines for use in establishing and negotiating professional service fees related to capital projects; (4) Assist in development of chain of communication and plan for proper coordination and scheduling of capital projects by various departments; (5) Assist in development and implementation of standard procedures and reporting formats for use in management of capital projects, as well as development of capital projects (summary) reporting system and format (such as scheduling and budget); (6) Assist various departments as needed with capital project development, contract development and negotiations, and projects management; (7) Provide special assistance as needed with review/negotiation of major proposed contract changes; (8) Assist public works department directors in the management and administration of specialized public works projects. (9) Work closely with directors of public works in the management and administration of public works projects and coordinate such projects with public works department directors, consultants, contractors and administrative staff. (10) Assist in contract administration. This includes, but not limited to review and approval of payments to engineers and consultants, as well as contract amendments. (11) Coordinate public works department efforts with state and federal agencies. (12) Assist the public works director in securing state and federal funds for capital projects. This includes the preparation of grant related documents. (13) Resolves or assist in resolving problems related to capital improvement projects. (14) Assist the public works director in the investigation and handling of complaints. (15) Perform specific public works department coordination tasks, as delegated by public works director. (16) Coordinate problem resolution efforts within public works departments, as instructed by public works director. (17) Assist the public works director in creating policies and procedures affecting public works department. (18) Attend and participate in various meetings regarding public works projects, administration and planning and development. (19) Prepare various reports and coordinate report preparation within public works department groups, as delegated by the public works director. (20) Advise the parish president and director of public works regarding public works issues. (21) Supervise personnel assigned to capital project administration; reviews and monitors work, assigns tasks, approves leave, evaluates work performance and recommends discipline. (22) Assist the public works director with all activities relating to the department operating and capital budgets. (Ord. No. 19877, § 1, 11-20-96; Ord. No. 23051, § 2, 5-9-07) Secs. 2-262—2-270. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 11. - DEPARTMENT OF SEWERAGE

    Footnotes: --- (26) --Cross reference— Sewerage, § 27-16 et seq.; drainage and sewage disposal, § 27-142 et seq.

    Sec. 2-271. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of sewerage and the position of director of sewerage is hereby created to assist the public works department. (Code 1961, § 2-440; Ord. No. 17556, § 1, 7-13-88)

    Sec. 2-272. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of sewerage shall have a four-year degree in civil or sanitary engineering with five (5) years' administrative experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created and perform any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (b) Appointment. The director of sewerage shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of sewerage shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-442; Ord. No. 25736 , § 19, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 19, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-272 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-273. - Duties of director.

    The director of sewerage shall assist the public director in directing, controlling and supervising functions of the control of sanitary waste within the public sewer system to include its collection, treatment and disposal. (Code 1961, § 2-441; Ord. No. 17556, § 2, 7-13-88) Secs. 2-274—2-285. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 12. - DEPARTMENT OF WATER

    Footnotes: --- (27) --Cross reference— Water, § 27-175 et seq.

    Sec. 2-286. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of water and the position of director of water are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over water functions of the parish; shall direct, control and supervise the functions of providing a safe and potable water supply to all parts of the parish; and shall coordinate all activities pertaining thereto. (Code 1961, § 2-490)

    Sec. 2-287. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of water shall have a four-year degree in civil, sanitary, chemical engineering, or related acceptable degree, with five (5) years' administrative experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created; or ten (10) years of significant management experience with a public utility. (b) Appointment. The director of water shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of water shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-492; Ord. No. 25736 , § 20, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 20, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-287 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-288. - Duties of director.

    The director of water shall: (1) Provide policy development and management guidance in the area of water; (2) Evaluate department operations in water and report to director of public works on a regular basis; (3) Be responsible for capital facilities planning; (4) Counsel with the director of public works on policy decisions affecting water; (5) Direct administrative and field staff; (6) Direct the water department in formulating and evaluating operating policies, programs and procedures; (7) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (8) Coordinate budget formulation activities in the water department; (9) Prepare policy statements and plans for the water department under the direction of the director of public works. (Code 1961, § 2-491; Ord. No. 17557, § 1, 7-13-88) Secs. 2-289—2-300. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 13. - DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS

    Footnotes: --- (28) --Cross reference— One stop development services office, § 2-875.25 et seq.; roads and bridges, Ch. 29; traffic and motor vehicles, Ch. 36.

    Sec. 2-301. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of public works and the position of director of public works are hereby created which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over the sewerage, water, drainage, streets, engineering and parkway functions of the parish. (Code 1961, § 2-450; Ord. No. 17552, § 2, 7-13-88)

    Sec. 2-302. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of public works shall possess the following qualifications: (1) A four-year degree in engineering with eight (8) years' relevant experience and active registration as a professional engineer in the state; (2) Five (5) years of experience as an assistant city manager or department director with comparable experience; and (3) Ten (10) years of significant management experience with a public works agency. (b) Appointment. The director of public works shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of public works shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-452; Ord. No. 17552, § 3, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 24723, § 1, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25736 , § 21, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 21, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-302 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-303. - Duties of director.

    The director of public works shall: (1) Be responsible for all public works functions including administration, financial operation, construction, maintenance and policy development in the areas of water, sewerage, drainage, streets, engineering, including traffic engineering, parkways, capital projects, flood plain management; and environmental affairs; (2) Evaluate department operations for public works and environmental affairs and report to the parish president and parish council on department performance on a regular basis; (3) Be responsible for capital facilities planning; (4) Counsel with the parish president and the parish council on policy decisions affecting public works and environmental affairs; (5) Direct administrative and laboratory support staff; (6) Direct the public works group and department of environmental affairs in formulating and evaluating operating policies, programs and procedures; (7) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (8) Coordinate budget formulation activities in the public works group and department of environmental affairs; (9) Prepare policy statements and plans for the public works group and department of environmental affairs under the direction of the parish president. (Code 1961, § 2-451; Ord. No. 17552, § 4, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 24723, § 2, 4-9-14)

    DIVISION 13.1 - OFFICE OF TECHNICAL ADVISOR TO THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS

    Footnotes: --- (29) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 25846 , § 1, adopted Aug. 21, 2019, moved the sections of div. 13.1, §§ 2-301.1—2303.1, to div. 14. Inasmuch as div. 14 contained reserved sections, §§ 2-316—2-330, sections 2-301.1—2-303.1 have been renumbered as sections 2-316—2-318 to maintain Code format and at the discretion of the editor. Later, Ord. No. 25928 , § 1, adopted Dec. 18, 2019, added Div. 13.1, §§ 2-301.1—2-303.1, as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-301.1. - Office of technical advisor to the department of public works created.

    There is hereby created the office of technical advisor to the department of public works and the position of technical advisor to the department of public works within the department of public works to serve the parish by providing technical advice and support to the administration, council, public works director and all public works groups. ( Ord. No. 25928 , § 1, 12-18-19)

    Sec. 2-302.1. - Qualifications, appointment, and salary for technical advisor to the department of public works.

    (a) Qualifications. The technical advisor to the department of public works shall possess the following qualifications (1) A four-year degree in engineering with five (5) years' relevant experience and active registration as a professional engineer in the state; (2) Five (5) years of experience in local government operations and consulting work: and (3) Five (5) years of significant management experience with a public works agency. (b) Appointment. The technical advisor to the department of public works shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c)

    Salary. The salary of the technical advisor to the department of public works shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. ( Ord. No. 25928 , § 1, 12-18-19)

    Sec. 2-303.1. - Duties of the technical advisor to the department of public works—Generally.

    The technical advisor to the department of public works' duties shall include but are not limited to the following: (1) Assist the public works director with all activities related to public works functions including administration, financial operation, construction, maintenance and policy development in the public works groups; (2) Advise parish president and council members on technical related issues; (3) Attend and participate in council and council agenda meetings; (4) Serve as a replacement to the public works director during his/her absence; (5) Prepare and deliver reports and information to parish officials and administration; (6) Assist with the handling of complaints received by the administration and council; (7) Assist with the interviewing and hiring of public works personnel; (8) Assist public works director with the planning of capital improvement projects and capital facilities planning; (9) Assist the parish attorney's office with technical related issues pertaining to litigation; and (10) Serve as an advisor on the technical evaluation committee. ( Ord. No. 25928 , § 1, 12-18-19)

    DIVISION 13.5. - DEPARTMENT OF ECOSYSTEM AND COASTAL MANAGEMENT

    Sec. 2-304. - Department of ecosystem and coastal management created.

    There is hereby created the department of ecosystem and coastal management and the position of director of ecosystem and coastal management to serve the parish, oversee ecosystem and coastal restoration and management responsibilities in Jefferson Parish, and provide an integrated, holistic approach to the restoration and management of the coastal and floodplain ecosystems and environments that comprise Jefferson Parish. ( Ord. No. 25964 , § 1, 3-11-20)

    Sec. 2-305. - Qualifications, appointment, and salary for director of ecosystem and coastal management.

    (a) Qualification. The Director of Ecosystem and Coastal Management shall be qualified by education with a minimum of a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in environmental engineering or science, business, or a related field, and five (5) years coastal zone or floodplain management experience to direct and coordinate the various purposes for which the office has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of ecosystem and coastal management shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of ecosystem and coastal management shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. ( Ord. No. 25964 , § 1, 3-11-20)

    Sec. 2-306. - Duties of the director of ecosystem and coastal management—Generally.

    The director of ecosystem and coastal management's duties shall include but are not limited to the following: (a) Hire, train, and manage personnel; assign tasks and projects; monitor field work; evaluate employee work performance, including any salary increases, disciplinary action/discharges, and employee transfers and promotions; approve leave requests and enforce administrative management policies and personnel rules. (b) Develop coastal restoration and protection strategies for the Parish's diverse ecosystem. (c) Coordinate the parish's interaction with the public, federal and state agencies involved in comprehensive planning activities for coastal restoration and management to maximize the funding of projects benefitting Jefferson Parish. (d) Provide oversight and coordinates with the department of floodplain management to ensure integrated ecosystem management. (e)

    Researches, prepares applications and manages all grants and projects with local and federal agencies including, but not limited to, RESTORE Act and GOMESA funds allocated to the parish. (f) Provides leadership and direction in the development and subsequent implementation of short and long range plans; gathers, interprets and prepares data for studies, reports, and recommendations which include the Jefferson Parish Coastal Master Plan. (g) Coordinate department activities with other parish departments and outside agencies. (h) Provide professional recommendations to the parish president, parish council, other elected officials and state and federal agencies regarding coastal protection and restoration and associated environmental issues in the parish. (i) Communicate official plans, policies and regulatory procedures to the general public, business and industry and elected officials. (j) Participate in the meetings of the Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority (CPRA); Coastal Wetlands Planning Protection and Restoration Act (CWPPRA) Task Force and Technical Committee, and relevant meetings of other ecosystem planning and management entities in the region and state. (k) Perform public information/promotional services through the development of coastal protection, restoration, and enhancement public service announcements, brochures, television and radio appearances, and other publicity efforts; and address various civic and business organizations. (l) Promote the education of Jefferson Parish residents on ecosystem and coastal restoration and management issues. ( Ord. No. 25964 , § 1, 3-11-20) Secs. 2-307—2-315. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 14. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (30) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 25964 , § 3, adopted March 11, 2020, repealed div. 14, which pertained to the department of coastal management and derived from Ord. No. 25185 , § 1, adopted July 27, 2016; Ord. No. 25736 , § 22, adopted Feb. 6, 2019; and Ord. No. 25846 , §§ 1, 2, adopted Aug. 21, 2019. Secs. 2-316—2-330. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 15. - DEPARTMENT OF CENTRAL GARAGE

    Sec. 2-331. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of central garage and the position of director of central garage is hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over repair and maintenance of all parishowned vehicles and heavy equipment. (Code 1961, § 2-470)

    Sec. 2-332. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of central garage shall be qualified by professional training and at least four (4) years' relevant management experience for this position and devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department/ principal office has been created and any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (b) Appointment. The director of central garage shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of central garage shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-472; Ord. No. 25736 , § 23, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 23, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-332 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-333. - Duties of director.

    The director of central garage shall: (1) Manage department operations of central garage, including establishment of a comprehensive preventative maintenance program for parish vehicles and repair and maintenance of parish vehicles; (2) Provide policy guidance to the president in the area of the central garage; (3) Direct administrative and field staff assigned; (4) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to central garage; (5) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (6) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the department of central garage; (7) Centralize control and standardization of specifications and purchase of vehicles and operating equipment, with cooperation of all directors, to provide greater standardization and improved efficiency/usage. (Code 1961, § 2-471; Ord. No. 24677, § 1, 2-5-14) Secs. 2-334—2-345. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 16. - DEPARTMENT OF STREETS

    Footnotes: --- (31) --Cross reference— Roads and bridges, Ch. 29.

    Sec. 2-346. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of streets and the position of director of streets is hereby created to assist the department of public works in his duties and responsibilities. (Code 1961, § 2-480)

    Sec. 2-347. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of streets shall be qualified by education and at least five (5) years of related management experience and devote his entire efforts to the purpose for which this department/principal office has been created and perform any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (b) Appointment. The director of streets shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of streets shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-482; Ord. No. 25736 , § 24, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 24, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-347 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-348. - Duties of director.

    The director of streets shall assist the public works director in directing, controlling and supervising the following functions: (1) Maintenance of the parish-wide street network; (2) Directing the operations of the park and parkway division; (3) Maintenance of parish rights-of-way and enforcement of the weed and pollution control ordinance; (4) Providing canal maintenance support for the drainage department as required. (Code 1961, § 2-481)

    DIVISION 16.5. - DEPARTMENT OF PARKWAYS

    Footnotes: --- (32) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 23957, § 5, adopted February 2, 2011, amended the title of Div. 16.5 to read as herein set out. Prior to inclusion of said ordinance, Div. 16.5 pertained to similar subject matter. See also the Code Comparative Table.

    Sec. 2-349. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of parkways and position of director of parkways are hereby created to assist the department of public works in its duties and responsibilities. (Ord. No. 17550, § 1, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 23957, § 6, 2-2-11)

    Sec. 2-350. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of parkways shall be qualified by education, training and at least five (5) years of administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his entire effort to this purpose for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of parkways shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of parkways shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 17550, § 2, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 23957, § 7, 2-2-11; Ord. No. 25736 , § 25, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 25, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-350 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-351. - Duties of director.

    The director of parkways shall: (1) Manage department operations in parkways by coordinating budget formulation and management activities with the advice and consent of the director of public works; (2) Prepare reports for the parish president and the director of public works on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives; on special problems; and on plans as required for review; (3) Direct administrative and field staff assigned to this department; (4) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to beautification projects on public rights-of-way with the advice and consent of the director of public works; (5) Supervise maintenance operation on medians and other public property including street sweeping, grass cutting, gardening, litter removal and sign removals; (6) Set policy for the trim and removal of trees/stumps on parish rights-of-way. (Ord. No. 17550, § 3, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 23957, § 8, 2-2-11) Secs. 2-352—2-360. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 17. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (33) --Editor's note— Section I of Ord. No. 17437, adopted Feb. 10, 1988, repealed §§ 2-361—2-363, relating to the department of community services, derived from Code 1961, §§ 2-510—2-513, and Ord. No. 16746, §§ 1, 2, adopted Jan. 8, 1986. The animal shelter division is now included in § 2-91. Secs. 2-361—2-375. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 18. - DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION

    Footnotes: --- (34) --Cross reference— Parks and recreation, Ch. 21.

    Sec. 2-376. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of parks and recreation and the position of director of parks and recreation are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over parks and recreation functions of the parish. (Code 1961, § 2-385; Ord. No. 22510, § 4, 5-25-05; Ord. No. 23957, § 3, 2-2-11)

    Sec. 2-377. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of parks and recreation shall be qualified by education, training and at least five (5) years of administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of parks and recreation shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of parks and recreation shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-387; Ord. No. 25736 , § 26, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 26, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-377 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-378. - Duties of director—Generally.

    The director of parks and recreation shall: (1) Manage department operations in recreation and parks; (2) Provide policy guidance to the parish president and the chief administrative assistant in the area of recreation and parks; (3) Direct administrative and field staff assigned to this department; (4) Counsel with the parish president, the parish council, the chief administrative assistant and the deputy chief administrative assistant on policy decisions affecting recreation, Lafreniere Park, and Parc Des Familles; (5) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relative to recreation with advice and consent of the chief administrative assistant; (6) Direct the formulation and evaluation of operating policies; programs and procedures relating to Parc Des Familles and present them to the Parc Des Familles Citizen Advisory Board for their review and evaluation; (7) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (8) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performances against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required for review by the chief administrative assistant; (9) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the parks and recreation department. (Code 1961, § 2-386; Ord. No. 17438, § I, 2-10-88; Ord. No. 22510, § 4, 5-25-05; Ord. No. 23957, § 4, 2-2-11; Ord. No. 25861 , § 6, 9-18-19)

    DIVISION 18.5 - DEPARTMENT OF LAFRENIERE PARK

    Sec. 2-379. - Department and position of director created.

    The Department of Lafreniere Park and the position of Director of Lafreniere Park are hereby created to assist the department of parks and recreation, which this department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over Lafreniere Park. (Ord. No. 25861 , § 2, 9-18-19)

    Sec. 2-380. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The Director of Lafreniere Park shall be qualified by: (1) Associates Degree in Business Management, Park Management or closely related field supplemented by five (5) years current experience and/or training that includes direct management responsibility, including managing large events, as well as park maintenance, development and planning responsibility; or (2) An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. (b) Appointment. The Director of Lafreniere Park shall be appointed by the Parish President with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of parks and recreation shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 25861 , § 3, 9-18-19)

    Sec. 2-381. - Duties of the director—Generally.

    The Director of Lafreniere Park shall: (1) Manage operations of Lafreniere Park and formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relative to maintaining the park, and act as department liaison to Patrons of Lafreniere Park. (2) Directs department budget development; administers department budget; approves expenditures. (3) Oversees special events and projects to achieve goals for the park, and performs oversight and/or coordination of marketing and fundraising conducted on behalf of, or for the benefit of, Lafreniere Park. (4) Promotes, implements and monitors landscaping maintenance of grounds and facilities including landscape crew operations. (5) Responsible for social media management for Lafreniere Park which includes overseeing the regular download, upload, and/or entering of content used for social media including but not limited to departmental web page, Twitter, Facebook and Instagram. (6) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and prepares special reports on operating problems or plans, as required. (7) Attends and participates in council and other meetings; advises council, parish president and administration regarding Lafreniere Park issues. (8) Responds to public's questions or concerns, may be required to speak to local groups or clubs on issues related to Lafreniere Park. (9) Responds to emergency situations. (Ord. No. 25861 , § 4, 9-18-19) Secs. 2-382—2-390. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 19. - DEPARTMENT OF LIBRARY

    Footnotes: --- (35) --Cross reference— Library board, § 2-631 et seq.; library, Ch. 18.

    Sec. 2-391. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of library and the position of director of library are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over the parish public library and its branches. (Code 1961, § 2-500)

    Sec. 2-392. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of library shall be qualified by education, training and prior administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of library shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of library shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-502; Ord. No. 25736 , § 27, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 27, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-392 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-393. - Duties of director.

    The director of library shall: (1) Manage department operations in the parish public library and its branches; (2) Provide policy guidance to the parish president and the chief administrative assistant in the area of the parish library and its branches; (3) Direct administrative and field staff assigned to this department; (4) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to library programs with the advice and consent of the chief administrative assistant; (5) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performances against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required for review by the chief administrative assistant; (6) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the department of library; (7) Other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (Code 1961, § 2-501; Ord. No. 17439, § I, 2-10-88) Secs. 2-394—2-405. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 20. - ANIMAL SHELTER DEPARTMENT

    Footnotes: --- (36) --Editor's note— Section 4 of Ord. No. 16746, adopted Jan. 8, 1986, repealed former §§ 2-406—2-409, the substantive provisions of this division, relating to the department of animal and pest control, derived from Code 1961, §§ 2-250—2-253, and Ord. No. 15916, § 1, adopted Feb. 29, 1984. See § 2-364. Subsequently, Ord. No. 20257, § 1, adopted Jan. 14, 1998, amended Div. 20, §§ 2-406—2-408, and the title thereof, by changing references to "department of animal welfare and control" and "department of animal and pest control" to "animal shelter department." See the Code Comparative Table. Cross reference— Animal and fowl, Ch. 7.

    Sec. 2-406. - Department and position of director created.

    The animal shelter department and the position of director of the animal shelter department are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over the animal shelter and animal welfare and control functions of the parish, including but not limited to the enforcement of animal welfare ordinances and for the collection, impounding, seizing or holding, care and disposal of animals in the parish. (Ord. No. 18471, § 4, 2-19-92; Ord. No. 20257, § 1, 1-14-98)

    Sec. 2-407. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of the animal shelter department shall be qualified by education, training, and experience relative to the animal welfare/control/shelter profession and shall devote his/her entire efforts to the purpose for which this department has been created. The director of the animal shelter shall possess the following qualifications: (1) A bachelor's degree supplemented by at least three (3) years of paid professional administrative and/or management experience, which includes two (2) years relative to animal welfare/control/shelter profession or related experience; or (2) An equivalent combination of education, management and ten (10) years experience in the field of animal control or welfare. (b) Appointment. The director of the animal shelter department shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of animal shelter shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 18471, § 4, 2-19-92; Ord. No. 20257, § 1, 1-14-98; Ord. No. 25736 , § 28, 2-6-19; Ord. No. 25818 , § 1, 7-24-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 28, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-407 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-408. - Duties of the director.

    The director of the animal shelter department shall: (1) Manage department operations of animal welfare and control and the animal shelter; (2) Provide policy guidance to the president in the area of animal welfare/control/public health; (3) Direct administrative and field staff persons assigned to this department; (4) Formulate, implement and evaluate operating policies, procedures and programs relative to animal welfare/control/public health services with the advice and consent of the president; (5) Prepare reports on departmental operations, evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required for review by the president; (6) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the animal shelter department; (7) Coordinate activities with animal shelter advisory board and its mandated authorities. (Ord. No. 18471, § 4, 2-19-92; Ord. No. 20257, § 1, 1-14-98) Secs. 2-409—2-414. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 20.5. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (37) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 23957, § 1, adopted February 2, 2011, repealed Div. 20.5, §§ 2-415—2-417, which pertained to the Department of Parc Des Familles. See also the Code Comparative Table. Sec. 2-415—2-420. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 21. - DEPARTMENT OF JEFFERSON COMMUNITY ACTIONS PROGRAMS

    Sec. 2-421. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of Jefferson Community Actions Programs (Jeffcap) and the position of director of Jefferson Community Actions Programs are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over Jefferson Community Actions Programs functions of the parish. (Code 1961, § 2-310)

    Sec. 2-422. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The Director of Jefferson Community Actions Programs (Jeffcap) shall be qualified by education, training and prior administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The Director of Jefferson Community Actions Programs shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of Jefferson Community Action Programs shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-312; Ord. No. 25736 , § 29, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 29, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-422 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-423. - Duties of director.

    The Director of Jefferson Community Actions Programs shall: (1) Manage department operations in Jefferson Community Actions Programs; (2) Provide policy guidance to the president in the area of Jefferson Community Actions Programs functions; (3) Direct administrative and field staff assigned to this department; (4) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to community actions programs; (5) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (6) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the Jefferson Community Actions Programs Department; (7) Other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (Code 1961, § 2-311; Ord. No. 24676, § 1, 2-5-14) Secs. 2-424—2-430. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 22. - DEPARTMENT OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS

    Sec. 2-431. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of community development programs and the position of director of community development programs are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over community development program functions of the parish. (Code 1961, § 2-320)

    Sec. 2-432. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of community development programs shall be qualified by education, training and administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of community development programs shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of community development programs shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-322; Ord. No. 25736 , § 30, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 30, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-432 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-433. - Duties of director.

    The director of community development programs shall: (1) Manage department operations in community development programs; (2) Provide policy guidance to the president in the area of community development programs; (3) Direct administrative staff assigned to this department; (4) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to community development. (5) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required. (6) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the community development programs department. (Code 1961, § 2-321; Ord. No. 24662, § 1, 1-15-14) Secs. 2-434—2-440. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 23. - DEPARTMENT OF WORKFORCE CONNECTION

    Footnotes: --- (38) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 21964, § 1, adopted Aug. 6, 2003, amended the title of Div. 23 from "department of employment and training" to "department of workforce connection." See also the Code Comparative Table.

    Sec. 2-441. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of workforce connection and the position of director of workforce connection are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over workforce connection functions of the parish. (Code 1961, § 2-330; Ord. No. 18380, § 1, 10-2-91; Ord. No. 21964, § 1, 8-6-03)

    Sec. 2-442. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of workforce connection shall be qualified by education, training and administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of workforce connection shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of workforce connection shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-332; Ord. No. 18380, § 1, 10-2-91; Ord. No. 21964, § 1, 8-6-03; Ord. No. 25736 , § 31, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 31, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-442 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-443. - Duties of director.

    The director of workforce connection shall: (1) Manage department operations in workforce connection; (2) Provide policy guidance to the parish president in the area of workforce connection; (3) Direct administrative and field staff assigned to this department; (4) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to workforce development programs; (5) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (6) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the department of workforce connection. (Code 1961, § 2-331; Ord. No. 18380, § 1, 10-2-91; Ord. No. 21964, § 1, 8-6-03) Secs. 2-444—2-455. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 24. - DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT

    Footnotes: --- (39) --Cross reference— Personnel, Ch. 23.

    Sec. 2-456. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of human resource management and the position of director of human resource management are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over human resource management, including employee training, employee benefits and development, hospitalization benefits and claims, EEOC response, unemployment compensation claims functions of the parish, occupational health, labor law, substance testing, labor relations, judicial and executive pay plan administration, and the administration and management of parish-wide safety programs and initiatives. (Code 1961, § 2-340; Ord. No. 17050, § I, 10-8-86; Ord. No. 18381, § 1, 10-2-91; Ord. No. 21410, § 2, 10-1001; Ord. No. 21526, § 2, 2-27-02; Ord. No. 24600, § 1, 10-16-13)

    Sec. 2-457. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of human resource management shall be qualified by education, training and prior administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his entire efforts to this purpose, for which this department has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of human resource management shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of the department of human resource management shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Code 1961, § 2-342; Ord. No. 17731, § 1, 4-19-89; Ord. No. 18381, § 1, 10-2-91; Ord. No. 21410, § 2, 10-1001; Ord. No. 21526, § 2, 2-27-02; Ord. No. 25736 , § 32, 2-6-19)

    Sec. 2-458. - Duties of director.

    The director of human resource management shall: (1) Manage departmental operations and supervise staff persons of human resource management, safety division, benefits division and training division; (2)

    Provide policy guidance to the parish president in the areas of human resource management, training and development, occupational health and benefits administration, and safety administration; (3) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required for review by the parish president; (4) Provide technical advice and assistance to the administration, appointing authorities and their supervisors in the areas of discipline, civil service appeals and classification; leave usage; equal employment opportunity; performance evaluation; changes in federal, state and local employment laws; human resource planning and staffing; job study and analysis; and case preparation in conjunction with appeals, legal and court actions;
