(5) Recommend to the parish president regarding changes in the parish organizational structure, creation of new job classes and reallocation of positions and/or incumbents requested by parish departments; (6) Identify the parish's training and development needs, develop programs of instruction, promote and conduct training for employees of all operating departments and evaluate the effectiveness of the instruction presented; (7) Manage occupational health programs, and an occupational nurse program for all departments of parish government; (8) Formulate and evaluate operating policies and programs relating to human resource administration and training; (9) Administer employee benefits program including preparation of bid specifications, analysis of submitted bids and preparation of reports/recommendations to advise the administration and insurance advisory and coordinating committee as to final selections; investigate complaints and claim handling problems; prepare reports for the administration; (10) Administer the parish grievance program and formulate policies, procedures, regulations and guidelines to promote consistency concerning grievances throughout parish departments; (11) Educate and inform employees through letters, memos, meetings, employee newsletter and orientation programs about the benefits offered employees through parish government; (12) Write, prepare and distribute an employee news publication; (13) Administer employee recognition programs and employee community service programs; (14) Provide administrative management for the safety division and all safety matters and all practices of the safety division to prevent and/or reduce employee job-related accidents and injuries and loss of parish property and to provide for corrective action. (Code 1961, § 2-341; Ord. No. 17444, § 2, 2-10-88; Ord. No. 17731, § 2, 4-19-89; Ord. No. 18381, § 1, 10-2-91; Ord. No. 21410, § 2, 10-10-01; Ord. No. 21526, § 2, 2-27-02; Ord. No. 24600, § 2, 10-16-13) Secs. 2-459—2-464. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 24.5. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (40) --Editor's note— Section 1 of Ord. No. 17444, adopted Feb. 10, 1988, repealed §§ 2-465—2-470, relating to the department of training and development, derived from Ord. No. 17050, § II, adopted Oct. 8, 1986. See now § 2458. Secs. 2-465—2-470. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 25. - DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL AFFAIRS

    Sec. 2-471. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of environmental affairs and the position of director of environmental affairs are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over environmental services functions of the parish and all aspects of solid waste management, mosquito control, and public works environmental permitting. (Ord. No. 20898, § 2, 2-23-00)

    Sec. 2-472. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of the department of environmental affairs shall be qualified by education, training and commensurate administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his efforts to the purpose for which this office has been created and any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (b) Appointment. The director of the department of environmental affairs shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of the department of environmental affairs shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 20898, § 2, 2-23-00; Ord. No. 25550 , § 1, 4-4-18; Ord. No. 25736 , § 33, 2-6-19)

    Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 33, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-472 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-473. - Duties of director.

    The director of environmental affairs shall: (1) Provide policy development and management guidance in the area of environmental services, solid waste management, and mosquito control; (2) Evaluate department operations and report to the parish president and parish council on departmental performance on a regular basis and counsel with the parish president and parish council on policy decisions affecting the department; (3) Be responsible for capital facilities planning; (4) Direct administrative and field staff; (5) Direct the department in formulating and evaluating operating policies, programs and procedures; (6) Prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (7) Coordinate budget formulation activities in the department; (8) Coordinate, plan, and monitor all aspects of mosquito control, and solid waste management in the parish, including the administration and monitoring of all contracts relating to mosquito control, solid waste collection and disposal; (9) Assist all parish departments with the preparation and submittal of all federal and state environmental permits for parish projects; (10) Assist the parish relative to all environmental issues and grant programs as directed by the parish president; (11) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to the department. (Ord. No. 20898, § 2, 2-23-00) Secs. 2-474—2-485. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 26. - DEPARTMENT OF CITIZENS' AFFAIRS

    Sec. 2-486. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of citizens' affairs and the position of director of citizens' affairs are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over all requests and complaints received by the parish council, parish president and/or any administrative department. Additionally, the department and position shall exercise direct administrative supervision and coordination of all activities relating to special events occurring in Jefferson Parish as exemplified by Carnival/Mardi Gras parades, St. Patrick's Day parades and Irish-Italian parades and administrative management of regulatory activities associated with all special events requiring permits in Jefferson Parish and the formulation and coordination of litter control measures and awareness campaigns in Jefferson Parish. Additionally, the department and position shall exercise administrative supervision and coordination of all duties, responsibilities and activities related to citizens' with disabilities. (Ord. No. 24724, § 4, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25927 , § 1, 12-18-19)

    Sec. 2-487. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of citizens' affairs shall be qualified by education, training and commensurate administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his efforts to the purpose for which this office has been created and any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (b) Appointment. The director of citizens' affairs shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of citizens' affairs shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 24724, § 4, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25736 , § 34, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 34, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-487 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-488. - Duties of the director; generally.

    The director of citizens' affairs shall: (1) Provide policy development and management guidance in the area of citizen requests and complaints; special events, including Carnival/Mardi Gras events, litter control and awareness campaigns, and Citizens' With Disabilities. (2) Evaluate and report on a regular basis to the parish president and the chief operating officer information on the operations of the department of citizens' affairs, as well as in the area of special events, including Carnival/Mardi Gras events, litter control, and Citizens' With Disabilities. (3) Counsel with the parish president and the chief operating officer for information on policy decisions affecting these areas; (4) Supervise these areas and their respective employees in formulating and evaluating operating policies, programs and procedures, and effective and efficient job performance; (5) Coordinate and prepare reports on departmental and office operations, including Carnival/Mardi Gras and special events, and Citizens' With Disabilities, evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required; (6) Coordinate budget formulation activities in the department; (7) Coordinate, plan and monitor all aspects of Citizens' With Disabilities, Carnival/Mardi Gras, and special events in the parish, including the administration and monitoring of all contracts relating to Carnival/Mardi Gras and special events; (8) Provide information for the Parish of Jefferson relative to accessibility, housing, transportation, advocacy, and legislation which pertains to the needs of the disabled, support groups and organizations, and other benefits available to citizens of Jefferson Parish with disabilities; (9) Provide ongoing monitoring of parish owned facilities and programs to ensure accessibility and availability to the handicapped and disabled; (10) Establish programs to educate the business sector on the needs of citizens of Jefferson Parish with disabilities; (11) Formulate and evaluate programs to make the public aware of existing laws and regulations and to provide technical assistance to parish officials on the requirements of the handicapped and disabled. (12) Coordinate and ensure that the names of all police officers and firefighters who have lost their lives in the line of duty are promptly and properly memorialized on the appropriate Jefferson Parish monuments to recognize them for their dedicated and unselfish service to the community. (13) Provide administrative services to the office of senior citizens' services and the office of cross-cultural community outreach. (Ord. No. 24724, § 4, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25927 , § 1, 12-18-19) Secs. 2-489—2-492. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 26.2. - OFFICES OF SENIOR CITIZENS' SERVICES

    Sec. 2-493. - Office of senior citizens' services and position of coordinator created.

    The office of senior citizens' services and the position of the coordinator of the office of senior citizens' services are hereby created, which office and position shall have direct administrative supervision over senior citizens' services functions of the parish, and direct administrative supervision for all duties, responsibilities and activities related to the office of senior citizens' services. (Ord. No. 24724, § 5, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25927 , § 2, 12-18-19)

    Sec. 2-494. - Coordinator—Qualifications, appointment, and salary of coordinator.

    (a) Qualifications. The coordinator of the office of senior citizens' services shall be qualified by education, training, and administrative and/or management experiences to direct and coordinate the various purposes for which the office has been created. (b) Appointment. The coordinator of the office of senior citizens' services shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the coordinator of the office of senior citizens' services shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 24724, § 5, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25736 , § 35, 2-6-19)

    Sec. 2-495. - Same—Duties.

    The coordinator of the office of senior citizens services shall: (1) Provide policy guidance to the parish president and the chief operating officer on matters of concern to and affecting the senior citizens of the parish. (2) Formulate and evaluate policies in the area of senior citizens' needs and requirements. (3) Serve as liaison between the parish president, the advisory board for the elderly, and the Jefferson Council on Aging, Inc. (Ord. No. 24724, § 5, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25927 , § 2, 12-18-19)

    DIVISION 26.3 - OFFICE OF FILM JEFFERSON

    Sec. 2-496. - Office of Film Jefferson and position of film coordinator created.

    There is hereby created the division of film to serve the Parish of Jefferson and to oversee all filming and production responsibilities in Jefferson Parish and assist the director of citizens' affairs in coordinating special events and marketing strategies for Jefferson Parish under the department of citizens' affairs. (Ord. No. 24902 , § 1, 2-11-15; Ord. No. 25206 , § 1, 8-24-16)

    Sec. 2-497. - Qualifications, appointment and salary for the coordinator.

    (a) Qualifications. The film coordinator shall be qualified by education, training, and administrative and/or management experiences to direct and coordinate the various purposes for which the office has been created. (b) Appointment. The film coordinator shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the film coordinator shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 24902 , § 1, 2-11-15; Ord. No. 25736 , § 36, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 36, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-497 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications, appointment and salary of the film coordinator" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of coordinator," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-498. - Duties of the film coordinator—Generally.

    The film coordinator's duties shall include but are not limited to the following: (1) Administer the daily operations of the Office of Film Jefferson. (2) Handle marketing logistics, including but not limited to advertising campaigns and creating advertisements. (3) Regular reporting to film committee on status of projects. (4) Develop, implement and monitor annual budget for film office. (5) Formulate, implement and evaluates policies for film office. (6) Administer film incentive rebate files. (7) Conduct on-location film checks. (8) Issue, suspend and revoke film permits. (9) Perform all other duties as required or directed relative to the successful implementation and operation of the film office. (10) Coordinates all dedication ceremonies held at Veterans Memorial Square, or at other locations as appropriate, for fallen policemen and firemen. (11) Creates and implements marketing strategies to promote Jefferson Parish carnival parades and other special events unique to Jefferson Parish. (12) Carries out effective public relations initiatives designed to broaden public awareness and support for department services and/or programs; drafts articles for parish public information office. (13) Appears on radio and television to share information as directed and approved. (14) Meets with business people in the community as directed and/or required. (Ord. No. 24902 , § 1, 2-11-15; Ord. No. 25206 , § 2, 8-24-16)

    DIVISION 26.4. - OFFICE OF CROSS-CULTURAL COMMUNITY OUTREACH

    Sec. 2-499. - Office of cross-cultural community outreach created.

    There is hereby created the office of cross-cultural community outreach to serve the Parish of Jefferson by strengthening diverse cultural relationships through building capacity, professional partnership development, and managing community outreach and external communication for diverse communities. (Ord. No. 25221 , § 1, 9-21-16; Ord. No. 25927 , § 3, 12-18-19)

    Sec. 2-500. - Qualifications, appointment and salary for the coordinator.

    (a) Qualifications. The cross-cultural community outreach coordinator shall be qualified by education, training, and administrative and/or management experiences to direct and coordinate the various purposes for which the office has been created. (b) Appointment. The cross-cultural community outreach coordinator shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the cross-cultural community outreach coordinator shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 25221 , § 1, 9-21-16; Ord. No. 25736 , § 37, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 37, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-500 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications, appointment, and salary for cross-cultural community outreach coordinator" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary for the coordinator," as set out herein. Sec. 2.500.1. - Duties of the cross-cultural community outreach coordinator—Generally. The cross-cultural community outreach coordinator's duties shall include but are not limited to the following: (1) Administers the daily operation of the office of cross-cultural community outreach; (2) Develops and implements a strategic plan to strengthen diverse cultural relationships through building capacity, professional partnership development, and managing community outreach; (3) Provides programs and services to support cultural awareness initiatives and to improve cross-cultural communications; (4) Pursues a variety of projects to design and implement outreach programs for culturally diverse population; (5) Identifies and creates action plans for key concerns of diverse cultural communities; (6) Performs all other duties as required or directed relative to the successful implementation and operation of the office of cross-cultural community outreach. (Ord. No. 25221 , § 1, 9-21-16)

    DIVISION 27. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (41) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 24700, § 1, adopted March 19, 2014, repealed Division 27, §§ 2-501—2-503, which pertained to the department of federal liaison and derived from Code 1961, § 2-410—2-412. Secs. 2-501—2-508. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 28. - COMMUNITY JUSTICE AGENCY

    Footnotes: --- (42) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 21662, § 1, adopted Sept. 11, 2002, renumbered Ch. 2, Art. VI, Div. 19.5, §§ 2-780— 2-780.2 as Ch. 2. Art. V, Div. 28, §§ 2-509—2-509.2, as set out herein. See the Code Comparative Table for a detailed analysis of inclusion of Ord. No. 21662.

    Sec. 2-509. - Agency and position of director created.

    A department to be known as the community justice agency and the position of director of the community justice agency are hereby created, which department and position shall have direct administrative supervision over the adult supervision and corrections, the administrative and planning services, and the juvenile justice functions of parish government. The community justice agency shall serve as an umbrella agency to consolidate and operate all community-based and residential juvenile and adult criminal justice programs in parish government (except for the adult jail) and to provide administrative services for the effective operations of such programs. (Ord. No. 21662, § 1, 9-11-02)

    Sec. 2-509.1. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of the community justice agency shall be qualified by education and training, possess a thorough knowledge of the adult and juvenile criminal justice systems, demonstrate an ability to manage administrative operations, possess skills in operations and analysis techniques, have proven oral and written communication skills, demonstrate leadership ability in a local government setting, and have advanced administrative and/or managerial experience in criminal justice research, planning, coordination and evaluation. The director of the community justice agency shall also have the requisite educational and work experiences. (b) Appointment. The director of the community justice agency shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the parish council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of the community justice agency shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 21662, § 1, 9-11-02; Ord. No. 25736 , § 38, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 38, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-509.1 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-509.2. - Duties of the director of the community justice agency.

    The duties of the director shall include but not be limited to the following: (1) Develop and operate community-based programs and residential facilities for the adult and juvenile justice systems (except the adult jail); and provide for both the adult and juvenile system's coordination of the continuum of sanctions and services; (2) Direct all new or newly-refined adult community-based programs for both pre-trial and convicted offender populations, including but not limited to: pre-trial diversion, release, and supervision programs, alternatives to incarceration, and day reporting and intermediate sanctions facilities; (3) Direct the operations of the juvenile justice system, including both community and residential services for juveniles; (4) Direct the provision of administrative services to component parts of the agency; (5) Ensure coordination of funding requests and program development from component parts of the agency; (6) Work with the advisory board as directed by the parish president to provide the parish council with a master plan, analyze operational and programmatic impacts, prioritize recommendations, and review operational budgets of related agencies; (7) Work with the appropriate city, parish, state, federal and private agencies concerned with the administration of criminal justice to address criminal justice issues affecting the parish; (8) Ensure that the research, planning, and evaluation component of the administrative department conducts and disseminates the results of high-quality research; researches and distributes information about national and international best practices in criminal justice and juvenile justice; evaluates and monitors the effectiveness of all programs operated by the agency; makes recommendations for changes to programs based on the results of such evaluations; collects, analyzes, and publishes statistics and information relevant to criminal justice agencies; and serves as a resource and source of technical assistance to public officials and local units of government in determining policies, procedures, laws and regulations and in evaluating programs operated by other related agencies; and (9) Direct the operations of an automated accident reporting system/court case management system and related functions. (Ord. No. 21662, § 1, 9-11-02)

    DIVISION 28.1. - DEPARTMENT OF JUVENILE SERVICES.

    Footnotes: --- (43) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 21662, § 2, adopted Sept. 11, 2002, renumbered Ch. 2, Art. V, Div. 28, §§ 2-510—2512, as Ch. 2. Art. V, Div. 28.1, §§ 2-510—2-510.2, as set out herein. See the Code Comparative Table for a detailed analysis of inclusion of Ord. No. 21662.

    Sec. 2-510. - Agency and position of director created.

    A department to be known as juvenile services and the position of director of juvenile services are hereby created which department and position shall be responsible for operating both residential and community services for juvenile offenders. (Ord. No. 21662, § 2, 9-11-02) Sec. 2-510.1 - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director. (a) Qualifications. The director of juvenile services shall be qualified by education and training, possess a thorough knowledge of the juvenile justice system and relevant research in this field, demonstrate an ability to manage administrative operations and supervise staffs, have demonstrated skills in program development, have proven oral and written communication skills, demonstrate leadership ability, be familiar with operations of residential facilities, and be committed to treatment-oriented community-based programming for juvenile offenders. The director of juvenile services shall also have the requisite educational and work experiences. (b) Appointment. The director of juvenile services shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the parish council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of juvenile services shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 21662, § 2, 9-11-02; Ord. No. 25736 , § 39, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 39, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-510.1 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-510.2. - Duties of the director of juvenile services.

    The duties of the director shall include but not be limited to the following: (1) Operate the Rivarde Juvenile Detention Facility and any other residential facilities that may be developed; (2) Develop and operate a multi-disciplinary juvenile assessment center on the Rivarde site, in cooperation with other government officers and agencies; (3) Develop a community services unit, which will incorporate and merge all existing and/or perspective components of community supervision to ensure there exists an appropriate continuum of services and sanctions for juvenile offenders and families in need of services. (4) Coordinate with the director of the community justice agency and the director of administrative and planning services on issues of master planning, research, evaluation, and funding. (Ord. No. 21662, § 2, 9-11-02)

    DIVISION 28.2. - ADULT SUPERVISION AND CORRECTIONS

    Footnotes: --- (44) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 21662, § 3, adopted Sept. 11, 2002, renumbered Ch. 2, Art. VI, Div. 19.6, §§ 2-780.3 —2-780.5, as Ch. 2. Art. V, Div. 28.2, §§ 2-511—2-511.2, as set out herein. See the Code Comparative Table for a detailed analysis of inclusion of Ord. No. 21662.

    Sec. 2-511. - Agency and position of director created.

    A department to be known as adult supervision and corrections and the position of director of adult supervision and corrections are hereby created, which department and position shall have responsibility for operating all community-based programs for pre-trial and convicted adult offender populations (except the adult jail). The director shall be known as the "adult continuum manager." (Ord. No. 21662, § 3, 9-11-02)

    Sec. 2-511.1. - Qualifications and appointment of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of adult supervision and corrections shall be qualified by education and training, possess a thorough knowledge of the adult criminal justice system and pre-trial services programs generally, demonstrate an ability to manage administrative operations and oversee program development, have proven oral and written communication skills, demonstrate leadership ability in a local government setting, be familiar with residential operations for adult offenders, and demonstrate a commitment to community-based programming for adult offenders. The director of adult supervision and corrections shall also have the requisite educational and work experiences. (b) Appointment. The director of adult supervision and corrections shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the parish council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of adult supervision and corrections shall be established by the parish president within group II of the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 21662, § 3, 9-11-02)

    Sec. 2-511.2. - Duties of the director of adult supervision and corrections.

    The duties of the director shall include but not be limited to the following: (1) Develop and operate community-based programs for pre-trial and convicted offender populations; (2) Develop an offender assessment unit; (3) Develop a supervision services unit that includes, but is not limited to, programs to supervise and track offenders released pre-trial, home incarceration, and pre-trial diversion and counseling; (4) Develop and operate an intermediate sanctions facility; (5) Ensure that there exists an appropriate continuum of community-based services and sanctions for adult offenders; and (6) Coordinate with the director of the community justice agency and the director of administrative and planning services on issues of master planning, research, evaluation, and funding. (Ord. No. 21662, § 3, 9-11-02)

    DIVISION 28.3. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (45) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 24691, § 1, adopted March 19, 2014, repealed Division 28.3, §§ 2-512—2-512.2, which pertained to administrative and planning services and derived from Ord. No. 21662, § 4, adopted Sept. 11, 2002.

    Sec. 2-512. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 29. - DEPARTMENT OF TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION

    Sec. 2-513. - Department and position of director created.

    The department of transit administration and the position of director of transit administration are hereby created, which department and position shall have a direct administrative supervision over public transit functions of the parish. (Ord. No. 24725, § 2—4, 4-9-14)

    Sec. 2-514. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of transit administration will be qualified by education, training and prior administrative and/or management experience. (b) Appointment. The director of transit administration shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of the department of transit shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 24725, § 2—4, 4-9-14; Ord. No. 25736 , § 40, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 40, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-514 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment of director" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-515. - Duties of director.

    The director of transit administration shall: (1) Manage department operations in transit administration; (2) Provide policy guidance to the parish president and chief operating officer in the area of public transit; (3) Direct administrative and field staff assigned to this department; (4) Formulate and evaluate operating policies, programs and procedures relating to public transit, with advice and consent of the chief operating officer; (5) Coordinate budget formulation and management activities in the department of transit administration; (6) Prepare, file and administer all federal, state, and regional transit operating and capital grant programs; (7) Monitor transit-related contracts; (8) Seek out funding sources and develop programs to insure sufficient nonfarebox revenue is available to carry out transit programs; (9) Evaluate and report on a regular basis to the parish president and the chief operating officer regarding information on the operations of the department of transit administration; (10) Coordinate and prepare reports on departmental operations evaluating performance against established objectives, and special reports on operating problems or plans as required. (Ord. No. 24725, § 2—4, 4-9-14)

    DIVISION 30. - OFFICE OF TOURISM

    Sec. 2-515.1. - Created; functions; qualifications, etc.

    The office of tourism and the position of coordinator of the office of tourism are hereby created. (1) Position created; purpose. The position of coordinator of the office of tourism is hereby created to provide Jefferson Parish with essential tourism leadership and management during the office creation, start-up, developmental and planning phase, and professional leadership and administrative management upon establishing the office of tourism as a vital functioning, productive and public service, economic-enhancing component of the Jefferson Parish community, and to develop long term tourism plans of action, convention planning and assistance, to provide fiscal accountability and integrity for the daily operations of the office of tourism, and to represent Jefferson Parish at the highest possible level in its efforts to communicate and promote the maximum Jefferson Parish tourism experience. (2) Essential functions. The coordinator of tourism under the parish president shall: a. Plan, direct, and coordinator Jefferson Parish's active participation in tourism and to ensure that Jefferson Parish's interests in promoting tourism are maximized; b. Plan, coordinate, direct, originate, and present tourism development activities, programs, and initiatives to stimulate local, regional, state, national, and international awareness and interest in Jefferson Parish and its wealth of diverse cultural, social, recreational, family, and interesting destinations; c. Plan, coordinate and present informational materials and programs to stimulate interest and attract visitors to Jefferson Parish destinations, including convention planning and assistance; d. Directly supervise and administer all aspects of operations of the office of tourism; e. Serve as tourism liaison for Jefferson Parish Government and Parish business and civic groups, metro tourism organizations, State of Louisiana, and others active in the tourism industry; f. Represent the parish and the parish president for issues relating to tourism and serve as technical advisor to the parish for all tourism related matters. (3) Qualifications. The coordinator of the office of tourism shall be qualified by education, training, and prior successful work experience to direct and coordinate all aspects of the office of tourism and shall devote his/her entire efforts to the purpose, goals, and objectives for which this office and position has been created. (4) Appointment. The position of coordinator of tourism shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (5) Salary. The salary for the position of coordinator of tourism shall be established by the parish president within Group III of the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 19923, § 1, 1-8-97) Secs. 2-515.2, 2-515.3. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 31. - OFFICE OF BLIGHT ERADICATION AND COMMUNITY LIAISON

    Footnotes: --- (46) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 24882 , § 1, adopted Dec. 10, 2014, changed the title of Ch. 2, Art. V., Div. 31 from "Office of crime prevention and quality of life coordinator" to "Office of blight eradication and community liaison," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-515.4. - Office of blight eradication and community liaison created; composition.

    There is herby created the office of blight eradication and community liaison to serve the parish and to assist the department of property maintenance, zoning, and quality of life (PMZ/QOL), the department of code enforcement, the council, and the parish attorney in enforcing quality of life issues. The office is to be composed of two (2) positions of blight eradication & community liaison, wherein one (1) liaison shall serve the east bank of the parish and one (1) liaison shall serve the west bank of the parish. (Ord. No. 23460, § 1, 1-14-09; Ord. No. 24882 , § 2, 12-10-14; Ord. No. 25467 , § 1, 12-6-17; Ord. No. 25566 , § 1, 4-25-18) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25566 , § 1, adopted April 25, 2018, amended § 2-515.4 and in so doing changed the title of said section from "Office and position of the blight eradication and community liaison created; composition" to "Office of blight eradication & community liaison created; composition," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-515.5. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of blight eradication and community liaison.

    (a) Qualifications. The blight eradication & community liaison shall be qualified through a combination of education, training, and experience. (b) Appointment. The blight eradication and community liaison shall be appointed and removed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the blight eradication and community liaison shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan and funded using council district improvement/assistance funds, funds from participating council districts, or any other fund as approved by the council. (Ord. No. 23460, § 1, 1-14-09; Ord. No. 24882 , § 3, 12-10-14; Ord. No. 25467 , § 1, 12-6-17; Ord. No. 25566 , § 1, 4-25-18; Ord. No. 25736 , § 41, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 24882 , § 3, adopted Dec. 10, 2014, changed the title of § 2-515.5 from "Qualifications, appointment and salary of crime prevention and quality of life enforcement coordinator" to "Office and position of blight eradication and community liaison, appointment and salary of blight eradication and community liaison," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-515.6. - Duties of blight eradication and community liaison.

    The blight eradication & community liaison shall: (1) Work with PMZ/QOL and code enforcement regarding quality of life concerns in the parish; (2) Accept, on behalf of PMZ/QOL and code enforcement, complaints from the community regarding blighted/abandoned properties and/or quality of life issues; and assist with and direct complaints to the proper departments and appropriate departmental clerks for processing; (3) Assist directors and participate in sweeps with local utility companies; (4) Work within the parish computer management system to view, save, and print status updates and photos of violations; (5) Ascertain number of vacant/abandoned properties and their locations in the parish; (6) Perform mortgage and conveyance research to determine foreclosure status and ownership of blighted/vacant properties; (7) Work with the parish attorney's office in obtaining civil search warrants to enter vacant properties with inspectors; and report structural damage to the demolition and building abatement department; (8) Serve as liaison, in coordination with PMZ/QOL and code enforcement, between the council and community and attend, as necessary, civic association meetings to update residents on quality of life issues; (9) Attend bureau of administration and adjudication meetings and all other required meetings; (10) Provide updates/reports to the council, parish president, parish attorney, director of PMZ/QOL, director of code enforcement, et al.; and (11) Carry out any and all duties as assigned by the parish. (Ord. No. 23460, § 1, 1-14-09; Ord. No. 24753 , § 1, 6-11-14; Ord. No. 24882 , § 4, 12-10-14; Ord. No. 25467 , § 1, 12-6-17; Ord. No. 25566 , § 1, 4-25-18) Editor's note— Ord. No. 24882 , § 4, adopted Dec. 10, 2014, changed the title of § 2-515.6 from "Duties of crime prevention and quality of life enforcement coordinator" to "Duties of blight eradication and community liaison," as set out herein.

    DIVISION 32. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (47) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 20898, § 3, adopted Feb. 23, 2000, repealed Div. 32, §§ 2-515.7—2-515.10, which pertained to the department of solid waste and environmental impact. See the Code Comparative Table. Secs. 2-515.7—2-515.10. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 33. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (48) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 23538, § 1, adopted May 6, 2009, repealed Div. 33, §§ 2-515.11—2-515.13, which pertained to the department of homeland security. See also the code Comparative Table. Secs. 2-515.11—2-515.13. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 34. - DEPARTMENT OF SECURITY

    Footnotes: --- (49) ---

    Editor's note— Ord. No. 23288, § 2, adopted April 23, 2008, added Div. 34, "Department of Security." See also the Code Comparative Table.

    Sec. 5-515.14. - Principal office and position of director of security created.

    There is hereby created the office of and the position of director of security to serve the Parish of Jefferson. (Ord. No. 23288, § 3, 4-23-08)

    Sec. 2-515.15. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. (1) The director shall have a minimum of ten (10) years of law enforcement experience. (2) The director will have the ability to conduct investigations, interviews, covert and overt operations. (3) The director should have a general understanding of electronic surveillance and counter surveillance measures. (4) The director will be proficient in security driving, counter surveillance and attack countermeasures. (5) The director shall be certified as a personal protection specialist. (6) The director should be knowledgeable in security systems for new and remodeled structures. (7) The director shall have the highest moral character, integrity and commitment to excellence. (8) The director will maintain all qualifications in weapons, impact weapons and restraints required by the Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office (J.P.S.O) (9) The director shall maintain excellent physical condition. (b) Appointment. The director of security shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of security shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 23288, § 4, 4-23-08; Ord. No. 25736 , § 42, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 42, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-515.15 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications and appointment and salary of director of security" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-515.16. - Duties of director of security.

    The director of security shall: (1) The director will be responsible for the overall security of the employees and facilities of Jefferson Parish. (2) The director will interface with local, state and federal agencies to insure that intelligence files are kept up to date on matters concerning parish government and the security of the parish president. (3) The director shall provide security during meetings and hearings with employees. (4) The director shall coordinate police details with the parish departments to provide security at parish facilities and events. (5) The director shall coordinate with local, state and federal law enforcement agencies on matters of criminal investigations and intelligence gathering on matters involving parish employees or facilities. (6) The director shall perform an annual physical inspection of every parish owned or operated facility. The inspection will identify any potential security risks and provide recommendations on means and methods to reduce loss due to thefts and criminal conduct. (7) The director shall conduct internal investigations on crimes reported by or committed upon parish employees or at parish owned or operated facilities. (8) The director shall conduct investigations of unethical conduct by parish employees while on duty or representing the parish. (9) The director shall provide recommendations on security measures including, video, access control and loss control prevention on new parish buildings and facilities. (10) The director shall oversee and administer the contract between Jefferson Parish and the security equipment company. (11) The director shall supervise the identification control divisions of Jefferson Parish. (12) The director shall attend Department of Homeland Security and Louisiana OHSEP classes annually on antiterrorism, response to weapons of mass destruction and related courses. (13) The director shall oversee and administer the parish's contract with the private security guard company. (14) The director shall review inspection reports from the safety officer regarding access and security issues involving hazardous or controlled substances. The director will coordinate the development of corrective measures with the facility that was inspected and the safety officer. (15) The director shall be available to perform special assignments as directed by the chief administrative officer on an as needed basis. (16) The director of security shall report to a chief administrative assistant. (Ord. No. 23288, § 5, 4-23-08)

    DIVISION 35. - DEPARTMENT OF FLOODPLAIN MANAGEMENT AND HAZARD MITIGATION

    Sec. 2-515.17. - Department and position of the director of floodplain management and hazard mitigation created. There is hereby created the department of floodplain management and hazard mitigation and the position of director of floodplain management and hazard mitigation, which department and position shall have various duties and provide for related matters. (Ord. No. 24396, § 1, 12-12-12)

    Sec. 2-515.18. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of the department of floodplain management and hazard mitigation shall be qualified through a combination of education, training and commensurate administrative and/or management experience and shall devote his/her efforts to the purpose for which this office has been created and any other such activities and/or responsibilities as the parish president may direct. (b) Appointment. The director of the department of floodplain management and hazard mitigation shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of floodplain management and hazard mitigation shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 24396, § 1, 12-12-12; Ord. No. 25736 , § 43, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 43, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-515.18 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications, appointment and salary of the director of floodplain management and hazard mitigation" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-515.19. - Duties of the director of floodplain management and hazard mitigation.

    The director of floodplain management and hazard mitigation's duties shall include, but are not limited to the following: (1) Supervise and oversee the department of floodplain management and hazard mitigation, including but not limited to assigning tasks and projects; monitoring and reviewing work; and evaluating employee work performance; (2) Develops and monitors department budget and approves expenditures; (3) Develops department goals, policies and procedures and directs implementation; (4) Assist the parish relative to all floodplain management grant programs and hazard mitigation grant programs; (5) Serve as a liaison between the federal, state and parish legislative delegations on floodplain management and hazard mitigation issues; (6) Provide representation for the parish in local and regional planning activities that affect floodplain management and hazard mitigation; (7) Meet with elected officials, community and civic groups, and governmental entities; prepare and deliver presentations, speeches, and written communications, as directed; (8) Supervise parish compliance with all federal, state and local laws and regulations regarding floodplain management and hazard mitigation, including but not limited to the following: Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP), Community Rating System Program (CRS), FEMA Repetitive Loss, State Department of Transportation (DOTD), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) and Louisiana Governor's Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness (GOHSEP). (9) Prepare documents and timely reports, as directed; (10) Travel as necessary and directed; (11) All duties described herein will be performed in collaboration with the departments of engineering, planning, emergency preparedness, inspection and code enforcement, public information and any other department that may be identified as necessary participants. (12) Coordinates with the department of ecosystem and coastal management to ensure integrated ecosystem management. (Ord. No. 24396, § 1, 12-12-12; Ord. No. 25964 , § 2, 3-11-20)

    DIVISION 36. - DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY GRANTS AND ADMINISTRATION

    Footnotes: --- (50) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 25017 , § 1, adopted Sept. 23, 2015, added Div. 36 §§ 516—516.2 to the Code. Said provisions have been redesignated as 2-515.20—2-515.22, at the editor's discretion, for purposes of maintaining Code format.

    Sec. 2-515.20. - Department of public safety grants and administration created.

    There is hereby created the department of public safety grants and administration to serve the Parish of Jefferson and to oversee and assist in all aspects of emergency preparedness, response, and recovery in Jefferson Parish. (Ord. No. 25017 , § 1, 9-23-15)

    Sec. 2-515.21. - Qualifications, appointment and salary of director.

    (a) Qualifications. The director of public safety grants and administration shall be qualified by education, training, and administrative and/or management experiences to direct and coordinate the various purposes for which the office has been created. (b) Appointment. The director of public safety grants and administration shall be appointed by the parish president with the approval of the council. (c) Salary. The salary of the director of public safety grants and administration shall be established by the parish president within the pay grade for the position as defined in the executive pay plan. (Ord. No. 25017 , § 1, 9-23-15; Ord. No. 25736 , § 44, 2-6-19) Editor's note— Ord. No. 25736 , § 44, adopted Feb. 6, 2019, amended § 2-515.21 and in so doing changed the title from "Qualifications, appointment, and salary director of public safety grants and administration" to "Qualifications, appointment and salary of director," as set out herein.

    Sec. 2-515.22. - Duties of the director of public safety grants and administration—Generally.

    The director of public safety grants and administration's duties shall include but are not limited to the following: (1) Supervises and oversees the daily operation of the department of public safety grants and administration, including but not limited to assigning tasks and projects; monitoring and reviewing work; and evaluating employee performance; (2) Develops and monitors department's budget and approves expenditures; (3) Develops department goals, policies, and procedures and directs implementation; (4) Assists the parish relative to all emergency preparedness, response, and recovery programs; (5) Develops strategic grant initiatives and provides fiscal policy and administrative oversight on long term strategic plans to enhance the overall effectiveness of departments under operations; (6) Researches, writes, and monitors grant procedural requirements to ensure state and federal compliance and provides project management for grant awards for departments under operations; (7) Provides funding opportunity notification of federal grants and grant guidance to municipal safety agencies and volunteer fire departments; (8) Provides oversight on internal control systems for Homeland Security Grant Program equipment; (9) Collaborates with the director of floodplain management and hazard mitigation to enhance the parish's resiliency initiatives; (10) Attends public safety agency and working group meetings to enhance the overall public safety and emergency preparedness strategy throughout Jefferson Parish; (11) Performs all other duties as required or directed relative to the successful implementation and operation of the department of public safety grants and administration. (Ord. No. 25017 , § 1, 9-23-15)

    ARTICLE VI. - BOARDS, COMMISSIONS, COMMITTEES AND OTHER AGENCIES OF THE PARISH

    Alphabetical list of boards, etc. in Article VI: 9-1-1 Service Providers Board Advisory Board for the Elderly Animal Shelter Advisory Board Bid Disqualification Review Committee Bucktown Marina Advisory Board Children Youth and Planning Board Citizens Drainage Advisory Board Coastal Zone Management Committee Community Action Board Community Development Citizens Advisory Committee Community Justice Agency Advisory Board Criminal Justice Coordinating Council Data Processing Advisory Board East Jefferson Hospital Board Ethics and Compliance Commission Executive Safety Committee Financial Evaluation Committee Governmental and Ethics Compliance and Audit Committee Historical Commission Home Mortgage Authority Insurance Advisory and Coordinating Committee Jefferson Economic Development Office Jefferson Parish Charter Advisory Board Jefferson Parish Homeland Security Committee Juvenile Justice Juvenile Services Advisory Board Lafreniere Park Advisory Board Lasalle Park Advisory Board Library Board Marine Fisheries Advisory Board Public Works Change Order Review Committee Technical Evaluation Committee Transportation Advisory Board West Bank Rail Transportation Authority West Jefferson Medical Center Board

    Footnotes: --- (51) --Charter reference— Advisory and quasi-judicial boards, § 4.06. Cross reference— Aviation board of adjustment, § 3-19; ethical standards for members of authorities, boards, commissions and committees, § 23-117; regional planning commission, § 25-16 et seq.

    DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY

    Sec. 2-516. - Procedures and requirements pertaining to boards, commissions, committees and authorities created by parish council. (a) Applicability. This section is applicable to all boards, committees, commissions and authorities established by the parish council, either by resolution or ordinance, except for the following boards, committees, commissions and authorities: (1) Board of trustees of the employees' retirement system; (2) Legal services evaluation committee; (3) Board of Directors of East Jefferson Hospital; (4) Board of Directors of Jefferson Parish Hospital District No. 1; (5) Greater New Orleans Expressway Commission; (6) Jefferson Parish Finance Authority. (7) Housing authority; (8) Reserved; (9) Reserved; (10) Planning advisory board; (11) Regional planning commission; (12) Regulatory boards: a. Board of standards and appeals; b. Board of mechanical examiners; c. Reserved. d. Board of electrical examiners; e. Board of gas mechanical examiners; (13) Board of zoning adjustments; (14) Historical commission; (15) Reserved; (16) Animal shelter advisory board; (17) Reserved; (18) Reserved. (19) Reserved; (20) Reserved; (21) Criminal justice coordinating council; (22) Fire civil service board; (23) Community Action Advisory Board (JEFFCAP); (24) Reserved; (25) Public works change order review committee; (26) Library board; (27) Reserved; (28) Reserved; (29) Reserved; (30) Reserved; (31) 9-1-1 Advisory Board; (32)

    The Jefferson Economic Development Office (the Board of Commissioners to the Jefferson Parish Economic Development and Port District); (33) Bid disqualification review committee; (34) Reserved; (35) Reserved. (36) Jefferson Parish Marine Fisheries Advisory Board; (37) Technical evaluation committee; (38) Financial evaluation committee; (39) Insurance advisory and coordinating committee; (40) Data processing advisory committee; (41) Plantation Estates Subdivision Special District Board. (b) Definition. As used in this section, the word "board" shall be interpreted to mean any board, commission, committee or authority created by the parish council either by ordinance or resolution. (c) Standards for creation. All boards established by the council shall be established by either ordinance or resolution. A resolution shall be used where the board is to be advisory in nature and does not have authority to implement its recommendation without further action of the council. An ordinance shall be used when the board is to have independent authority to carry out policies and objectives and establish procedures without the express ratification of the council. An ordinance shall also be used where it is otherwise legally required or advisable. (d) Length of existence. All boards hereafter established will cease to exist twelve (12) months after their establishment if established by resolution or forty-eight (48) months if established by ordinance, provided that the council, in the ordinance or resolution creating a board may specify a lesser or greater period for the life of the board. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, if a board remains active beyond what would otherwise be the expiration date of that board and the resolution or ordinance creating the board did not specify a lesser or greater period for the life of the board, then that board shall exist until the date of last action by the board or until the council specifically terminates the board, whichever occurs first. Council termination shall occur by resolution if the board were created by resolution or by ordinance if the board were created by ordinance. (e) Designation of chairperson(s). The ordinance and resolution establishing a board shall indicate the party or parties who will serve as chairperson(s). As an exception to this requirement, a board may be empowered to elect its own chairperson(s) in the ordinance or resolution establishing the board. (f) Designation of office of primary responsibility. Each ordinance or resolution establishing a board shall indicate the parish office, department or agency which shall serve as the focal point for inquiries or actions concerning the board. (g) Terms of office. Each ordinance or resolution establishing a board shall set forth the term of office of the various members. The length of the term shall be consistent with the purpose of the board and the other provisions of this section. If a member is appointed to fill a vacancy, this member shall serve until the expiration of term for which the vacated member was appointed. The council may in the ordinance or resolution establishing a board, establish other provisions as to terms or the filling of vacancies. However, if the board is terminated, either pursuant to provisions of subsection (d) or other action, the membership of the board shall be automatically terminated. (h) Approval of membership. All members of all boards created by the parish council shall be subject to the approval of the parish council and the terms of the members shall end at the expiration of the term of the council which appointed the membership, provided that the ordinance or resolution establishing the board may specify otherwise as relates to the approval of membership and terms of office. However, nothing herein shall affect the authority of a council to reconstitute any board with new membership during the council's term of office. (i) Exception. This section shall not apply to any boards, committees, commissions and authorities to which the council merely appoints members or representatives. (Code 1961, § 2-12; Ord. No. 15369, § 1a, 12-1-82; Ord. No. 15512, § 1, 4-13-83; Ord. No. 15999, § 4, 4-11-84; Ord. No. 17466, § 1, 3-9-88; Ord. No. 17488, § 1, 4-13-88; Ord. No. 17549, § 3, 7-13-88; Ord. No. 18438, § 2, 1-8-92; Ord. No. 18462, §§ 8—10, 2-5-92; Ord. No. 19171, § 5, 9-7-94; Ord. No. 20166, §§ 1—3, 10-22-97; Ord. No. 21328, § 1, 7-18-01; Ord. No. 21538, § 4, 3-20-02; Ord. No. 21734, § 2, 12-11-02; Ord. No. 24291, § 1, 6-13-12; Ord. No. 24816 , §§ 1, 2, 8-27-14; Ord. No. 25018 , § 6, 9-23-15; Ord. No. 24050 , §§ 1, 4, 6, 7-2711; Ord. No. 25897 , §§ 2, 3, 5, 11-6-19; Ord. No. 25898 , §§ 2—8, 11-6-19; Ord. No. 25959 , §§ 3, 6, 2-12-20)

    Sec. 2-517. - Per diem and expense limitations for boards, committees, commissions and other authorities.

    (a) Except as otherwise provided in subsection (b), each member of any Jefferson Parish board, committee, commission or other authority who is authorized to receive a per diem shall receive no more than one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) for each meeting attended by said member for no more than fifty-two (52) meetings per calendar year. The parish shall not reimburse any expenses incurred by any board, committee, commission or other authority or by any member thereof, unless said expenses are reasonable and necessary and are approved by the parish council prior to payment by the parish. (b) (1) Each member of the planning advisory board shall be paid by the parish a compensation of one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) per board meeting at which they serve in accordance with the provisions of section 33-1.22. (2) Each member of the board of zoning adjustments shall be paid by the parish a compensation of one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) per board meeting at which they serve in accordance with the provisions of section 33-1.23. (Ord. No. 18517, § 1, 5-6-92; Ord. No. 21525, § 1, 2-26-02; Ord. No. 23211, § 1, 12-12-07; Ord. No. 25621 , § 5, 8-8-18) Editor's note— It should be noted that § 6 of Ord. No. 23316, adopted May 21, 2008 provides, "Ordinance No. 23211, adopted December 12, 2007, will not be applied retroactively unless any board member received the maximum per diem established in Ordinance No. 23211, adopted December 12, 2007, without the correlating Section of the Code of Ordinances being amended."

    Sec. 2-518. - Adherence to Louisiana Public Meetings Law.

    (a) All boards, committees and commissions operating under the governing authority of Jefferson Parish shall strictly adhere to the requirements of the Louisiana Public Meetings Law. (b) The meetings of all said boards, committees and commissions shall be recorded on audio tape and proper identification of all persons whose voices are recorded shall be properly noted. Any portion of a meeting in executive session held in accordance with the Louisiana Public Meetings Law or other applicable authority shall be exempt from this requirement. (c) Such recordings shall be archived by their respective agencies for a period of not less than three (3) years and, during said period, shall be made available to the Jefferson Parish Council upon request and to the general public under the authority of the Louisiana Public Records Act. (d) All boards, committees and commissions shall submit an annual meeting calendar, which includes meeting dates, times and locations, key activities and anticipated major events, to the Jefferson Parish Council Clerk by December 31 of the year preceding the year to which the meeting calendar applies. Said calendar may be amended by the board, committee or commission, and all such amendments shall be submitted to the council clerk within ten (10) working days of the amendment. However, boards, committees and commissions which meet on an irregular or as-needed basis shall be exempt from this requirement. (e) The requirements of subsections (b), (c) and (d) above shall not apply to ad-hoc and non-standing boards, committees and commissions. However, such boards, committees and commissions shall submit written summaries of their meetings and actions taken by them to the parish council clerk within ten (10) working days of each meeting. The clerk shall distribute copies of the summaries to each councilman. (Ord. No. 21328, § 2, 7-18-01)

    Sec. 2-519. - Criteria for membership of certain boards, committees and authorities.

    (a) No person shall serve simultaneously as a member on any two (2) or more of the following boards, committees or authorities: • Jefferson Parish Economic Development Office (JEDCO). • East Jefferson Hospital Board of Directors. • Jefferson Parish Hospital Service District No. 1 Board of Directors. • Board of Standards and Appeals. • Board of Zoning Adjustments. • Jefferson Parish Finance Authority. • West Jefferson Holdings, LLC Board of Directors. (b) No person shall serve simultaneously as the principal administrative officer of the Jefferson Economic Development Office, East Jefferson General Hospital, West Jefferson Hospital, the Jefferson Parish Finance Authority or the Jefferson Parish Housing Authority and as a member of any of the boards, committees or authorities named in subsection (a) herein. For purposes of this section, "principal administrative officer" shall include, but shall not be limited to the president, director, chief executive officer or any similarly titled position which corresponds to the highest ranking member of the organization's administration. (c) No person who has a business relationship with a member of the Jefferson Parish Council shall be eligible to serve as member of any of the boards, committees or authorities named in subsection (a) herein. For purposes of this section, "business relationship" shall mean sharing in any compensation received by any business or firm which a member of the Jefferson Parish Council either partially or fully owns or controls. This section excludes publicly traded companies. (d) (1) All members of the boards, committees or authorities named in subsection (a) herein shall be legally domiciled in Jefferson Parish. All such members shall be required to submit to the parish clerk the following documents as proof of domicile in Jefferson Parish: a. A copy of the member's Louisiana driver's license or Louisiana identification card; b. A copy of the member's Jefferson Parish voter registration card; c. An original affidavit executed by the member attesting to the member's residency in Jefferson Parish, similar in form to the affidavit of residency required for the qualification of candidates for elective office in Louisiana; and d. An original affidavit executed by the member attesting that the member has no substantial business relationship with a member of the Jefferson Parish Council as such relationship is are defined in subsection (c) herein. (2) The parish clerk shall retain the documents submitted in compliance with subsection (d)(1) herein for the duration of the member's term of service on the board, committee or authority for which the documents were submitted. (Ord. No. 23748, § 1, 2-10-10; Ord. No. 24697, § 1, 3-19-14; Ord. No. 25018 , § 7, 9-23-15; Ord. No. 25088 , § 1, 2-17-16)

    Sec. 2-520. - Staff serving boards, committees, commissions, and other agencies.

    The parish council shall serve as the appointing authority of staff serving the planning advisory board and the board of zoning adjustments. (Ord. No. 25621 , § 6, 8-8-18) Secs. 2-521—2-525. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 2. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (52) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 25302 , § 3, adopted Feb. 1, 2017, repealed Div. 2, §§ 2-526—2-529, which pertained to governmental and ethics compliance and audit committee and derived from Ord. No. 23787, § 3, adopted March 24, 2010 and Ord. No. 24233, § 1, adopted March 7, 2012. Secs. 2-526—2-535. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 2.3. - ETHICS AND COMPLIANCE COMMISSION

    Footnotes: --- (53) --Editor's note— Formerly, portions of Ord. No. 11027, were codified as Div. 2.3, §§ 2-536—2-536.13. At the request of the city the pension ordinances in their entirety have been included in the Code. Therefore, the user is directed to Ch. 23, Art. VII, Div. 3 for up-to-date pensions ordinances in their entirety. Subsequently, Ord. No. Ord. No. 24011, § 2, adopted May 11, 2011, enacted provisions designated as a new Div. 2.3 to read as herein set out. See also the Code Comparative Table.

    Sec. 2-536. - Ethics and compliance commission.

    Pursuant to Section 4.10 of the Jefferson Parish Charter, an ethics and compliance commission is hereby established to be administrative, advisory, and quasi-judicial in nature and authorized to review, interpret, render advisory opinions on all matters that are the subject of its jurisdiction and authority. The ethics and compliance commission shall perform such other administrative, advisory or quasi-judicial duties as may be assigned to it by law, ordinance or resolution. (Ord. No. 24011, § 2, 5-11-11)

    Sec. 2-537. - Composition.

    (1) Membership. The commission shall consist of five (5) members, all of whom shall be domiciled in and electors of the parish. And shall be appointed by the parish president from lists of three (3) nominees each submitted by the presidents or chancellors of Tulane University Loyola University of the South, Xavier University, University of New Orleans, and Delgado Community College. Each appointment is subject to approval by a majority of the members of the parish council. (2) Qualifications. No member may hold any elective or appointed position with the parish nor any other government or political party office or have held such position within two (2) years before appointment to the ethics and compliance commission. (3) Removal. A member of the ethics and compliance commission may be removed only for cause in accordance with the procedures established in Section 4.10 of the Jefferson Parish Charter. (4) Vacancy. Within ten (10) days of a president's or chancellor's recommended appointee's vacancy being created, the parish president shall request the university presidents or chancellors to submit within thirty (30) days lists of three (3) nominees each to the parish president for consideration to fill the unexpired term. Within thirty (30) days of receiving the lists of nominees, the parish president shall submit a selection to the parish council for its consideration. Within thirty (30) days of receiving a nomination by the parish president, the council shall approve or reject the appointment. (5) Term. The initial terms of the members shall be as follows: (a) The member nominated by the University of New Orleans shall serve an initial term of one (1) year from the date of the appointment; (b) The member nominated by Tulane University shall serve an initial term of two (2) years from the date of the appointment; (c) The member nominated by Delgado Community College shall serve an initial term of three (3) years from the date of the appointment; (d) The member nominated by Loyola University shall serve an initial term of four (4) years from the date of the appointment; and (e) The member nominated by Xavier University shall serve an initial term of five (5) years from the date of the appointment. At the expiration of the initial term of each member and at the expiration of the term of each succeeding member, a successor shall be appointed to serve for a term of five (5) years. If no new member is nominated timely by the appropriate college or university for an expired membership position, the existing member in that position shall continue to serve until replaced. However, appointments to replace any member who serves beyond his or her term shall be made only for the remainder of such member's unexpired term. Each term following the initial term for a commission member shall expire on May 8th of the fifth year of the term. (6) Public meetings. The meetings of the ethics and compliance commission shall be open to the public in accordance with the Louisiana Open Meetings law. (7) Quorum. Three (3) members of the ethics and compliance commission shall constitute a quorum for the purpose of transacting the business of the commission. (8) Rules and regulations. The ethics and compliance commission, pursuant to Section 4.10 of the Jefferson Parish Charter, shall adopt rules and regulations governing the transaction of its business not inconsistent with the laws of the State of Louisiana and ordinances of the Parish of Jefferson. (9) Staff. The ethics and compliance commission may employ necessary staff in accordance with section 4-10 of the Jefferson Parish Charter. (10) Investigations. For purposes of an investigation or a hearing, the ethics and compliance commission may administer oaths and affirmations, subpoena witnesses, compel their attendance, take evidence, and require the production of any records which the commission deems relevant or material to an investigation or hearing. (Ord. No. 24011, § 2, 5-11-11; Ord. No. 24513, § 1, 6-26-13)

    Sec. 2-538. - Jurisdiction, powers and authority.

    (a) Jurisdiction. The ethics and compliance commission shall be the ethics board or ethics body of Jefferson Parish and shall administer and enforce the provisions of the code of ordinances and the regulations, rules and orders issued hereunder regarding ethics and standards of conduct for Jefferson Parish employees, officials and other persons who are the recipients of public funds, or who are engaged in the performance of a parish governmental function, who do business with the parish, or are in a position to influence the conduct of parish employees or officials. (b) Powers. Pursuant to Section 4.10 of the Jefferson Parish Charter, the ethics and compliance commission may establish additional recommendations for the code of ordinances pertaining to ethics and standards of conduct for Jefferson Parish employees, officials and other persons who are the recipients of public funds, or who are engaged in the performance of a parish governmental function, who do business with the parish, or are in a position to influence the conduct of parish employees or officials. The commission may issue advisory opinions, promulgate rules regarding the interpretation and enforcement of the parish's ordinances, rules and regulations pertaining to ethics and standards of conduct, refer cases for investigation on referral or complaint, retain counsel, and impose fines. (Ord. No. 24011, § 2, 5-11-11)

    Sec. 2-539. - Advisory opinions.

    The ethics and compliance commission shall prepare and promulgate procedures for requesting official advisory opinions pertaining to parish ordinances rules and regulations governing ethics and standards of conduct for Jefferson Parish employees, officials and other persons who are the recipients of public funds, or who are engaged in the performance of a parish governmental function, who do business with the parish, or are in a position to influence the conduct of parish employees or officials. All such official advisory opinions shall be in writing. All such official advisory opinions shall be distributed to all agencies of parish government and be accessible to all parish employees. (Ord. No. 24011, § 2, 5-11-11) Secs. 2-540—2-544. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 3. - COASTAL ZONE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE

    Footnotes: --- (54) --Cross reference— Planning and development, Ch. 25.

    Sec. 2-545. - Created.

    There is hereby created a coastal zone management committee. (Code 1961, § 2-45.12(a))

    Sec. 2-546. - Composition.

    The coastal zone management committee shall be composed of twenty-one (21) members and representing as many of the following interests as possible, such as: The oil-gas industry, agriculture and forestry, commercial fishing and trapping, sport fishing, hunting and recreation, ports and shipping, nature preservation— environmental protection, landowners, municipalities, solid minerals, industrial development, parish council member(s), parish planning department, wildlife and fisheries, tourism commission, fish or shellfish processors, and the parish coastal zone management agency. The membership shall be named by and serve at the pleasure of the council. (Code 1961, § 2-45.12(a), (b))

    Sec. 2-547. - Purpose.

    The coastal zone management committee is established for the purpose of verifying additional information that must be added to the coastal zone management maps, acting as a communication center for public opinion, for technical information coming from several sources, for coordination with the parish council in identifying parish problems, for pointing out changes that need to be made in the state's program, for providing input into the parish's plan based on their level of expertise on the coastal zone, their knowledge of local people, needs and problems and for other inputs into the parish's coastal zone management program and into the state's coastal resources program. (Code 1961, § 2-45.12(a)) Secs. 2-548—2-554. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 4. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (55) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 25959 , § 1, adopted Feb. 12, 2020, repealed div. 4, which pertained to the Bucktown Marina Advisory Board and derived from Ord. No. 23738, § 1, adopted Jan. 27, 2010. Secs. 2-555—2-570. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 5. - RESERVED

    Footnotes: --- (56) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 25898 , § 1, adopted Nov. 6, 2019, repealed Div. 5, §§ 2-571—2-574, which pertained to the citizens drainage advisory board and derived from Code 1961, § 2-803(a)—(e); Ord. No. 17225, §§ 1, adopted April 8, 1987; and Ord. No. 22042, § 1, adopted Nov. 5, 2003. Secs. 2-571—2-585. - Reserved.

    DIVISION 6. - PUBLIC WORKS CHANGE ORDER REVIEW COMMITTEE

    Footnotes: --- (57) --Editor's note— Ord. No. 18462, § 10, adopted February 5, 1992, rescinded § 2-586 which comprised Div. 6, West Bank Sewerage Facilities Advisory Committee. Former § 2-586 derived from Res. No. 34440, adopted September 27, 1978. Subsequently, Ord. No. 24291, § 2, adopted June 13, 2012, enacted provisions designated as a new Div. 6 to read as herein set out. See also the Code Comparative Table.

    Sec. 2-586. - Created.

    There is hereby created a public works change order review committee for the purpose of providing input to the parish council on certain change orders as specified in section 2-590 herein proposed for publicly-bid contracts between Jefferson Parish and any other person, firm or business; and on any matters related to public contracts on which the Jefferson Parish Council may from time to time request input from the committee. (Ord. No. 24291, § 2, 6-13-12)

    Sec. 2-587. - Composition; terms.

    (a) The public works change order review committee shall be composed of six (6) members. (b) There shall be one (1) duly authorized representative from each of the following departments: Public works, research and budget analysis, finance, parish attorney. The parish attorney's representative shall be a non-voting member. (c) There shall be two (2) appointments made by the parish council, one (1) of which shall be designated by the parish council as the chair of the committee. (d) No member of the public works change order review committee shall perform any services or receive any compensation under a Jefferson Parish bid contract, nor shall any person, firm or business for whom the committee member works or by whom the committee member is employed perform any services or receive any compensation under a Jefferson Parish bid contract during the member's term on the committee. In addition, no member of the public works change order review committee shall submit a bid nor shall any person, firm or business for whom the committee member works or by whom the committee member is employed submit a bid in response to a Jefferson Parish bid proposal during the member's term on the committee (e) The term of each member of the committee shall be for two (2) years, except that a committee member appointed by the council may be removed by the council at any time during the committee member's term without cause. Each committee member shall continue to serve beyond the term of his appointment until his successor is appointed. (Ord. No. 24291, § 2, 6-13-12)

    Sec. 2-588. - Bylaws.

    The public works change order review committee shall be authorized to adopt procedural rules and regulations not inconsistent with the laws of the State of Louisiana and ordinances of the Parish of Jefferson. (Ord. No. 24291, § 2, 6-13-12)

    Sec. 2-589. - Meetings.

    (a) The committee shall meet on the Monday prior to every council meeting which has a change order of the type specified in section 2-590 herein on the agenda for the council meeting.
